review: Overall I enjoyed dinner here, but the two hostesses need a lesson in customer service.  They didn't smile, they didn't even greet us.  We just waited for about 10 minutes to be seated while we were seemingly ignored.  I would have to either fire or rehire.  Then it got better.  Our waitress was fantastic.  Our kids got the kiss pizza and Mac and cheese with edamame.  It was really good, they both ate a lot, and the price includes a drink.  Nowadays many restaurants do not include a drink with kids meals.  The dessert was just a buck mire for each kid that was a haagen daas ice cream sundae-totally worth it.  I had a chic salad and Thai pizza, which was fine.  Will dine here again.

My first experience here was definitely 5 star, but the second was 1 or maybe 2. The first guy was really nice, and was a very nice server. The second time, it was the middle of the afternoon, and the restaurant was half empty. It took 5-10 minutes for the waitress to acknowledge us, then another 10 to ask for our drink order. We just wanted a dessert or two, so we ordered those with our drinks. Both the drinks and desserts arrived about 15 minutes later, and we didn't see our waitress at all until she brought them over. We'd hoped to have our drinks before the desserts came, but apparently she didnt' notice that it's nice to have them before our food. I was glad we only ordered desserts, who knows how long she'd have taken if we got something else. Overall, it's a very nice place, but some of the staff sucks.
Went there with the family (my son and fiance is visiting), food was outstanding, but the service was mediocore.

This place seems to take a lot of reservations because when we got seated, 1/3 of the restaurant was empty and there was quite a few parties outside waiting.  I've been to a few CPK and the food and service always seems to be the same. Nothing too special, but always reliable. We had an out of town guest and we were in the mood for pizza and this place hits the spot.

California Pizza Kitchens everywhere are usually busy, but this one is exceptionally busy.  We called ahead and still waited a good 45 minutes.  Mind you, every restaurant is busy...Waikiki is nothing but a confusion of congested tourists walking into one another.  I did not expect anything less.  I just thought with a call ahead it might work a little better.  The pizza was not prepared as we asked (which was understandable as it was so busy) but we were given the correct pizza shortly afterwards and we were so happy to get it.  Our waiter was wonderful and we had some very unfriendly patrons around him giving him a hard time.  Minus the waiting shenanigans, our experience was great especially due to our hard working and under appreciated waiter.

I don't typically like chains but I got somethings to say, "MOTHER TRUCKING AVOCADO EGG ROLLS." Yes, it's that darn good.  Service was good here. And half the wait time of Ala Moana's branch. No parking validation tho. So plus, minus there. This is Walter Cronkite and that's the way it is.

Food here has always been amazing but the service? not so much. My boss ALWAYS orders take out from here (about $800/month) and has now slowed that to once a month based on the service alone. Just this week the girl at the take out counter was short with me and a food courier from Room Service in Paradise. She even made me walk all the way back to my car to get the confirmation number for my order. This was a first and mind you that I had spoken with that same girl prior to picking up my order to ask if I needed to bring anything and she told me "no." Not to mention it was extremely hot at 12pm and and the escalators by pearl were all out of order. She also told me bread and utensils were in the bag and of course by the time I got back to the office, I realised they weren't. But I wasn't surprised as we are always missing at least one item from our order each time. May be they should focus more on whose their return customers instead of their unreliable tourism cash-cow. If only we could turn back the hands of time to where the service and the prices at CPK were better (like 5yrs back!).

Location makes it hard to park easily, but its Waikiki. Standard CPK with the typical menu. Nothing to scream about. A chain is a chain is a chain. Fortunately, this one is a decent chain with not a long wait.

California Pizza Kitchen, aka CPK, is a casual restaurant which happens to be one of my favorite places to dine for their fresh salads, pasta and sandwiches.  Even though they specialize in California-style gourmet pizzas, they also offer appetizers, small cravings, soups, salads, pasta, sandwiches, specialty dishes and of course desserts.  CPK makes one of the best BBQ chicken salads ever. It is made with fresh lettuce, tomatoes, black beans, corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, corn, tortilla chips, chopped BBQ chicken and Monterey Jack cheese all tossed in a garden-herb ranch dressing. Their salads are available in full entree as well as half order size. All the ingredients combined make this the most flavorful salad. It is so darn good. Their cranberry walnut chicken and turkey stack sandwiches is also so delicious along with their pastas. What makes the sandwiches taste so good is their homemade focacchia bread which is fresh, light and tasty.   For dessert so far I tried their red velvet cake however it is their butter cake which takes the prize. It is served warm with fresh whipped cream and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. OMG! The cake is heavenly delicious. For a chain restaurant their menu items are reasonably priced, they give good size portions and service received has been good.

I came here with a large group, and we had to wait about 45mins for a table. It wasn't that bad compared to other restaurants in Waikiki with no reservation on a Friday night.  When we finally got our table, I noticed that they moved two tables together in order to fit all 9 of us. One was a circular table that had 5 seats around it and the other was a rectangle for 4. Someone on our table said it looked like a..... yeah.  Anyways, as I was looking at the menu I had planned to get the garlic cream fettuccine, but since it was my friend's friend "birthday dinner" he ordered for everyone. We got 2 appetizers which was the spinach artichoke dip and the bbq chicken salad. Both were okay, I didn't eat much because I wanted to eat the main course...THE REAL FOOD lol whatever that was. Apparently we ordered the four cheese ravioli, pesto cream penne pasta, and if I remember correctly like 3 or 4 pizzas. I really liked the four cheese ravioli. I think I had one extra piece compared to everyone lol w/e they didn't want to finish it. The pasta was meh, I don't really like penne and it was a bit dry to my liking. Idk how we all finished all the pizzas because I only had ONE SLICE... and it was nothing special. I rather get my pizza from Pizza Hut.  So I thought the service was going pretty good until we got our bill and everyone was like hella surprised about it. As we passed on the bill to one another, I could tell something was wrong by the looks. When it finally got to me I was like wtf, the total was only $23. How is that possible for 9 of us LOL. Someone suggested we pay it and get outta there asap, but birthday boy said to our waitress that we got the wrong bill. I guess they were busy that night or something..but seriously double check the bill before you give it to us.

I love CPK! Their creative pizzas bring out the adventure in you and tastes great. Their variety of salads and appetizers certainly rank up there as well. However, the recent downsizing of portions and price increases is pretty ridiculous when you sit down and look at it. The half-sized salads are $10 while full-sized salads are $14-16. Their pizzas are anywhere from $12-16 as are their pastas. I've been to the Ala Moana, Kahala, and Waikiki locations and the prices are all the same. One gimmick that other restaurants should try is their occasional discounts. The manager gives random parties a scratch card. Bring it with you on your next visit, have the manager scratch it, and you might win big $$$! Or a discount on your food bill. Don't scratch it out yourself as that will disqualify it! I think this is a smart yet sneaky technique to get patrons to come back for more... If it weren't for the good food and the gamble (hehe), I probably would've gone elsewhere. Edit: Parking sucks in Waikiki. If you don't have a friend who lives nearby, I suggest you go to their other locations.

All right folks let's get to it......The food here is wonderful, once you get it. The atmosphere was very touristy. Went there with a small group for an evening out, as such the kitchen was short staff an the waiter we had SUCKED!!!!!  He did not once come by to check on us or refill waters. But the worst part was he screwed up the orders leaving stuff off and over charging the bill. Don't know if it was because of the automatic gratuity for the group but would recommend you going elsewhere. When all this was brought to the managers attention, she only offered us to be understanding because they were short of staff, really !!! Maybe that should of been said before we sat down.

As a natural born italian i can say i'm definitely picky about food, especially when it comes to Pizza. And even if CPK is a chain restaurant, i found their pizzas so tasty and well done.  My favorite is the Hawaiian with Pineapple and Canadian Bacon - definitely a must here! Large servings and great value for money (We came here 3 times in a week ) The service was great, the waiters are really nice. A place you can't miss in Waikiki.
I would eat here everyday if I could afford it. Favorites: spinach artichoke dip, Mediterranean appetizer rolls, thin crust pizzas, Thai crunch salad. The entire staff is super friendly too!

Kama'aina Discount Alert! This location ONLY... 15% for Kama'ainas! Well, go figure since it's like totally out of the way for kama'ainas. This location is pretty cool since it's new so they still have the new restaurant smell as opposed to the old stinky smell.

went there on sept 7 to celebrate my sons 21 birthday total of sixteen in our party.  prior to the party spoke to tricia several times on setting up for party and parking details each time she was gracious and patient with my many questions, also you can bring in a cake with no extra charge(many places charge a cake fee) also this is the only cpk that takes reservations and gives a kamaaina discount of fifteen percent. it is worth the drive from mililani, but not only for the perks, but they are super efficient and fast.  the other cpk needs to learn from them.  we had the best server name chad(san diego) he was on top of things not one mistake for our large party.  my son also got a free sundae the other servers helping were also great. we got to meet the very nice general manager darryl(i think thats his name looks like a nfl player) sorry my grammer not good only typing with one hand other dominant arm in sling.  also i spoke to Will on the phone to get things set up and so I have to say Tricia and Will were great on the phone.  Chad terrific server the rest also great dont know their names and great GM, thanks CPK you are number one for hawaii CPK.

The food was great. The service, well thats a different story.  We saw our waitress 3 times. 1) drink order 2)food order 3) the check. I had to fill our own water glasses. Order your food take out and take it back home or to your hotel.

Wow! Amazing restaurant!  Me and my wife was here yesterday (Monday the 24th) looking for a normal dinner, we got more than that!! Excellent service, the place was full but still it didn't take long before we had made an order, and some starter bred on our table!! When they saw that I had almost finished my Pepsi, they refilled it free of charge!! Then there's the food!! OMG! One of the best pizzas I have ever tried! And I have tried a few hundreds! The famous BBQ chicken pizza California style was simply amazing! Tasted like heaven!! Very good spaghetti says my wife, and she doesn't compliment food so often!! The dessert was also amazing! Try the butter cake! (Don't try it if you don't like butter though)  All in all a fantastic restaurant and a fantastic service as well!!  The price was also right! 50 dollar for a full meal including desserts and drinks!! Highly Recommended this place!!
Waikiki CPK in the best one in the state. I love their wild mushroom pizza and the hummus. Plus you get a Kamaaina discount on the whole bill.

Oh CPK...how I love you so! Your consistency is always greatly appreciated and your food always delicious. Not wow-ing or overwhelming, but consistently good and flavorful. That is why I was disappointed when I've sought you out in the desolate Waikiki and you failed me.  It's Waikiki location is typical of the CPK experience with its standard menu showcasing sandwiches, appetizers, pastas, pizzas, salads, desserts, and of course their small plates. It is a menu that everyone can find something that they will enjoy and simply put a party-pleaser. The ambiance is typical with indoor and outdoor seating. While you may want that "tropical" experience of being on an island, the patio can get a bit hot on some days. You'll thank me when the hot sun is bearing down on you and sweating out your drinks! That's pretty much where the differences end. Service is lackluster. I've found it to be hit or miss at the Waikiki location. The wait staff can be either attentive or inattentive depending on your server. Sitting at the bar took it to another level with the kitchen staff yelling profanities at each other on not just one but two occasions just made it uncomfortable to grab a bite with a friend.  If your looking for CPK food look no further, the service...eh, could use some work!

Service is great and the food is excellent. I tried their new shrimp scampi with zucchini noodles, it was great! I was full just eating half. Portion sizes are good. Wild mushroom pizza is also good to share. All of their salads are AH-mazing! Oh, also a must try are their assorted variety of iced teas... my personal favorite, peach iced tea. Can't wait for another great experience. During lunch the service can be slower, but it all depends on what day you go on. I would not recommending this venue for a quick lunch break... you'll spend at least one hour here.
Great service!   Had my usual grub which left my tummy happy!  Go see, Mary, she's great at what she does.  A huge Thanks to Lea, for also providing great customer service with a smile.
This place is okay but there other pizza places around the island that are much more authentic style pizza.  I felt like I was eating a Mccain frozen Pizza.

we ate at the ala moana location last night. Great service friendly waiter name Peter.. the new dessert was awesome !!! caramel pudding, very light and yummy!  a must try.. the california pizza was great too had avocado on top yum!! beer was cold served in a cold glass.. cannot drink cool beer has to be cold!! we all enjoyed ourselves... good job CPK!!!!!!! I left a nice tip!! appreciate great service TIPS = TO INSURE PROPER SERVICE

Besides the fact that this location is convenient for me to get to, since its right across of work, the food is good and people are pretty nice. I will usually sit up at the bar for my breaks since service is instant. I only got an hour to eat and pay, no time to lose!  They're pretty attentive, but there are times when they forget to bring out the bread for you and you have to ask.  Most times I totally forget till the end or I must be unbearably starving to remember to ask.  Oh, and don't be shocked if your bread is not hot, at least the plate is... I have my favorites the Sicilian Pizza, a crispy thin crust with spicy marinara, Italian sausage, spicy Capicola ham, salami, Mozzarella, shaved Parmesan, basil and oregano, and the other is Chicken Milanese, three breaded chicken breasts topped with arugula, tomatoes, and shaved parmesan cheese.  Super delicious! A bummer is that when I can't eat the whole Chicken Milanese I have asked the other location if they could do a half order of the chicken and add pasta, and it was never a problem.  At this location, you don't need to ask, I will already tell you, they won't be able to do it.... During midday is the best time to go if you don't wanna wait for a bar seat or table, its not slamming busy yet.  If you absolutely do not want to eat there and want your food ready to pick up, I love that you can go online and order your food and specify when you want to pick it up. A couple of years ago we used to also get orders delivered, I hate to say that I am not sure if they still do it, but it could be an option to ask if you need it! P.S. They have kama'aina for 10% off =)

What can I say about CPK. Known for their pizzas, but they also got pastas, salads and other delectables. What's great is their small delectables, you have to try the fried mac n cheese dish.. it's super scrumptious! You have to get dessert when you're done, their butter cake ala mode is to die for! This location is hard on parking since it is in Waikiki. Plus side is that kamaaina get 15% off here on dine in only.  Service can be a hit or miss depending on who's working.. but their hosts are usually always there wish a smile even through their busy dinner times. When it gets to peak hours, we're always able to just grab a seat at the bar. I eat here almost weekly and my friends and I have noticed that the cooking and flavors aren't always consistent.

This was my very first time coming to the Waikiki location.. and it's actually pretty nice.  My boyfriend and I walked in and there were a bunch of tourists waiting for a table.. although it seems like they just opened, the hostess told us the wait was about 10 minutes only because they need to get the tables set and seat everyone else. I also believe all the servers weren't there so they had to adjust the areas but it wasn't a problem.. we sat out on the lanai so we could creep on people walking up and down the strip. Our server was very nice and very attentive. Ordered the spinach artichoke dip (duh), mushroom pizza and shrimp scampi with zucchini fettuccine... that was soooo good!!! put some of that pasta on the pizza... winner winner chicken dinner. Was a nice place besides the fact that the guy sitting next to us was feeding the birds and they kept coming close to our table.. i wanted to kick the bird right into that guys face but whatever. What I was really surprised was that our server gave us a kamaaina discount which was so nice of him.

I've visited the three CPKs in town and this experience was by far the best, likely because there was surprisingly no wait for a party of our size (10 people).  This is amazing, considering it was peak dinner time on Saturday; a time slot that generally would require a 30 - 40 min wait at the Ala Moana restaurant and even MORE at the Kahala one.  I'm sure this may have been just serendipity because my friend was celebrating a birthday, but I caution you that you should not expect this each time you go there. Food at CPK is fairly consistent if you know what you want to get.  I'm a lover of meats on pizza, so I generally get the Meat Lovers or Sicilian.  I got a Sicilian this time around, and was no disappointed.  The food came fairly quickly and promptly, and our waitress was nice and checked on us a few times to see if we were okay.  The spinach artichoke dip was especially cheesy this time around, and is probably one of the better dips for the price out there at these kinds of restaurants.  A+ for that. CPK warrants a four-star rating simply because it fulfilled my expectations, but did not impress me to the point where a five-star rating is justified.  It is what you expect, and that's basically the only way to describe it.

Its a nice place with a great food but we had a worst customer service here on all waikiki area we been last 10 days..they put us in worst seats at the door while half table were empty and i ask to change a seat and they refused to me with no reason...really not nice people...

This is the worst CPK I have ever been to, and I've been to at least 5. If you want to go to CPK, go to the one at the mall location, at Ala Moana I believe is way better.  Service was mediocre, and apparently we did not have a server for a while due to lack of communication on CPKs part. The food was even more mediocre.  Chicken lettuce wraps - meh, Meat Pizza - OK, hard to go wrong, Peking Duck Pizza - Good, because I got to build it myself.  Apparently Hawaii does not give cash back for gift cards under $10... is it only a California thing???? The server ended up getting a good tip from my gift card balance.
Miserable service. Ala Moana store much better.

I signed up for their pizza dough club.  Which is an app and allows you to track the amount you spend at CPK and for every $100 you get $5 to spend on the next visit.  They also gave a free small plate coupon.   Worst experience ever!! After we were seated we waited for a while before our server came back to order.  The hostess saw we were waiting and came over to take our order.  I let her know the code the pizza dough app gave me and she had no idea what I was talking about.  Then I told her I have a free coupon for a free small plate.  This is the point where she had no idea what I was talking about and ran to get our server.   The server finally came back and I explained the whole situation to her.  She also had no clue as to what I was talking about and went to talk to her manager.  Without taking our order.  So we wait some more. When she finally comes back she says, "I talked to my manager and he said you have to have the coupon printed."  I told her I read the email and it said I could just give the number and show my app.  She finally takes our order and asks me to email her the coupon.  OMG  really? She FINALLY figures it out.   Here comes the bread... They changed their bread and butter to warm bread with herbs in olive oil.  thumbs down.  The bread has so much crust and it was soooooo hard.  Change it back please.   The manager brings our food.   Caramelized peach salad... should have been renamed to purple onion salad.  YUCK! Chicken quesadilla... just average White corn guacamole... was ok but the chips were STALE...  When the artichoke dip is so popular how are the chips stale?   This meal left me not satisfied..  WAH!!!

If you come here - do NOT leave without getting that pound cake looking desert with vanilla ice cream. Our server came by and asked us if we wanted desert, and we gave the typical, "oh no, we're so full" blah blah... and he was like, "have you guys never tried this?!?" and pointed at it on the desert menu - we could tell by the tone in his voice it wouldn't disappoint - seriously skip cheesecake factory across the street and come get this desert instead. Best ever.

It's a chain restaurant so most people have tried it and it has 4 locations for a reason.. it's pretty good. The reason i'm writing a revue for the waikiki location is basically because it has a 15% discount for kama'aina!!! same good food..only cheaper! and service is good everytime.. so far.

This really is for the take out in Waikiki.  Ordered through on line phone app, easy to use and got a prompt 20 minute pick up time.  Sounds good so far, however, only one person in take out area.  She has to take orders, explain to Japanese tourists the menu, greet the next person and so on.  It took us 10 minutes to get to the head of the line.  Now we are 30 minutes in, pizza not ready for 10 more minutes?  Another person is told their order is ready, asks for bread but told out of bread and will be 5 minutes.  Our order is now ready, 5 minutes after last guest left.  We ask for bread and told 5 minutes, we think it is a mistake and wait 7 minutes for bread (12 minutes after previous guest) to get 3 small cold pieces of par bake bread.  Took order back to hotel 1 hour after calling.  When we opened order, pizza cold, and our son's mac & cheese was just noodles - NO CHEESE! Good idea but needs a lot of work
If your hispanic DONT order the chile relleno. GROSS. if your white go Ahead.

Went in for lunch today and it was extremely busy. It was very apparent that they were way understaffed. Our server, Jordan, came by to apologize and would be back in 2 mins. True to word and took our order. Food and drinks came out in a very timely manner. Jordan was extremely busy but stopped by a few times. The manager stopped by also. Food was great and service was great, even though their situation was hectic. I will be back and enjoy again.

My girlfriend and I always have problems finding good food the few times we are in Waikiki. CPK is no exception. I should have known better. This was our first visit to CPK in Waikiki. We ate after lunch time, around 2:30. About 1/3 of the restaurant was filled. Not busy by any means. Server came by to give us our water. Nice guy. He accidentally dropped the tray of waters on our table and broke the glasses. No biggie. I asked if he was alright. Accidents happen. He came by to sweep up the glass. But he didn't come back to wipe down the ice and water off our table after he said he would. After maybe 10 minutes, I had to ask a bus boy to wipe it down. Again, it was not busy during this time. I am not sure why he couldn't come by for less than a minute to clean the table. Moving on, I ordered a half caesar with chicken and my girlfriend ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine. Food came out in good time. My salad was good, but I'm not giving kudos for not screwing up a salad. Unfortunately, as our waiter was pouring black pepper on my salad, he got half on the salad, and the other half on the table and in my water. My girlfriend wasn't fond of her order. She stated it was not prepared as well as previous times. She also said it was warm, not hot.  Basically, it was typical poor Waikiki service and lackluster food.

Pizza comes in one size which is 10 inches. The pizzas were "ok" nothing to be "wow'd over" by. I thought the pizzas were pricey for what they were but I guess I can't complain- it's a franchise. Waiter was friendly- if you're hungry order one pizza for yourself- the 2 pizzas for a family of four wasn't enough after a hike to diamond head crater

As the rating caption says, "I've experienced better." I live in the area and have been a return customer of CPK Waikiki and have dined in and used their online ordering system for pick up countless times but today was probably the most disappointing experience I've had at this branch. Note, this review is not of the food but of the service I just encountered 20 minutes ago. I ordered a salad online and went over to pick it up. I went straight to the take-out counter, like I've done so many times, and was promptly asked what name the order was under. The server was friendly until I handed him the receipt where I was to sign and OPTIONALLY put a tip. Since all he had to do was rip off the receipt and bag my salad, I didn't put a tip...like I've done every time I do an online order. As soon as the server looked the receipt he made a snide and rather loud comment to the other customers seated at the bar, "I serve 60 customers and I make $4. I love my job." Obviously, "I love my job" was said in a sarcastic tone. It was rude and uncalled for, especially because he was talking to other customers. Then his whole demeanor changed, he started throwing cups into the sink and slamming cabinets. I stood there humiliated and in silence as I felt the other customers stare at me.  One of the worst experiences I ever had in any restaurant...such a shame. I'd rather go to the branch in Ala Moana or Kahala Mall. Again, such a shame.

Been here plenty of times and CPK Waikiki never disappoints. Last time I went here , A petite lady named Michelle E. helped up. She was by far , the best waitress ever!! I recommend looking for her if you decide to eat here. We let her pick our dishes and her choices blew our minds!! She was very friendly and seemed to enjoy her job. I love people like her. they make you feel so comfortable!!

It's been awhile that we've gone to the California Pizza Kitchen in Waikiki.  The good thing is we were able to make a reservation for our party of 6.  They also give a 10% kamaaina discount, but that will be expiring 8/5/13.   We put all of our orders in when the waiter came to take our drink order.  It was a bit disappointing when our soup didn't come out until after our pizza orders.  We had to ask for straws for our drinks.  Other than that the food at CPK is always delicious.

California pizza is the same anywhere you go. This makes it reliable.  But its never going to be more than a four star review.  At least its affordable. Good choice if you want to avoid the wait at Jimmy Buffets.
Cpk in Waikiki has me waiting 10 minutes for extra croutons. Like I know you ain't baking them in the back. Server has asked if we were okay once. I have had much better.

Last night my son and I had dinner at CPK Waikiki.  There was a 15 min wait for a table so we head over to the counter where we had a birdseye view of the cooks preparing food.  My son who is 9 years old thought it was cool to not only sit at the counter but to watch the cooks make his food. Too funny!  The server/ bartender was super nice and very attentive.  He made us feel comfortable and welcome.  Never rushed us.  I had the Quinoa and Arugula Salad that was not only healthily but delicious!  It's hard to believe that something so yummy can be so darn healthily.  The portion size was more than enough (I'm a big eater). I definitely got my monies worth!   My son had the BBQ Chicken Pizza that was unfortunately a bit overdone (sort of burnt). We've been to at least five other CPK's in CA and it seems this is common. Not sure why? Kids are picky enough so you'd think they would try to get it right and not burn the pizza. :(   I should have sent it back but it was late and just "let it go".  That was the only negative thing....everything else was great.  I would have given this place 5 Stars but my sons pizza was a bomb.

Ate here on a Saturday night and was busy like I expected. The host at the front told us the wait was 20 minutes but waited less than was told which was a plus. It was so busy I was sure I would have a bad experience here but we were hungry and didn't want go else where. We just wanted to eat. I forgot our waitress name but she was so sweet. I ordered chicken Milanese and the BBQ chicken pizza, my boyfriend ordered a garlic pasta (I think?) with mushrooms (yum!!!!) and the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer. The chicken Milanese was okay, not to my tasting but the veggies and chicken were fresh and cooked right. BBQ chicken pizza was amazing and my favorite of all most. Our waitress was amazing, always checking up on us and refilling our drinks. When were done, we were payed out quickly. We got the kaimaina discount which I didn't even know about. I gave her a $10 tip, she deserved it. What was even more sweet of her was that she wrote a message on the back of our receipt saying "Thank you guys! Hope you guys have a great night! :)" It was so sweet. Would come again if I'm in Waikiki.

Hostess was friendly an service was great! We had no wait time and was given a table on the balcony over looking the pedestrian filled street below. Dinner was great, drinks were better and the price was outstanding. Both my wife and I were buzzed and only Spent $27 ($5 tip included)

I've eaten at this location a number of times and the service has always been great, friendly staff, good food.  BUT.... this last time was not so good.. I wanted to place an order to go as I work in Waikiki and only have a 20 min break, I thought why not just grab my food and go relax on my break? So I called and was put on hold for 5 mins, no big deal I understand it was probably busy on a Monday night in Waikiki. While on hold the "music" kept repeating "if you're waiting for an order, try ordering online its quick and easy" I did so and was confirmed my food would be ready for pick up at 7:04 I got there at 7 o clock and my order was not even placed? I was told I had to wait 20 mins. I explained to the bartender the situation. He was apologetic, but I was obviously very upset. I waited upset for 20 mins around other guests and was asked by others what had happened, I had no problem explaining my frustrations. I work in restaurants and customer service so I know that a guest should never be frustrated and upset at the service and if they are it is best to acknowledge them right away before they start spreading the bad news. I had to go back to work so I informed the bartender to cancel my order and that I wanted my money back. He said it would only be a few more mins so I waited and got my food. At that point I asked to speak to a manager the bartender said "oh, I didn't know you had time, I'll get a manager for you" I then waited around for a few more mins before deciding to just leave. on the way out I made a complaint to the hosts who informed a manager immediately. He came over and said this was the first he had heard of my situation. He was not very apologetic. Maybe he tried? or maybe he thought I was just trying to get free food, but I was honestly very upset. He did not seem like he cared to know the situation or have patience. He offered to refund my food or to give me a coupon for a free entree, but was not sincere at all & I felt uncomfortable accepting anything from them when they did not seem like they wanted to make it better.  A big waste of time!!! They need to get rid of their online ordering if it is not efficient. However, there are definitely some amazing and friendly servers at this location. If you get lucky, there is also a few not so pleasant.
This place really depends on who you get .  I would say most are not on it when it comes to service . I stopped going to this one. Other places are fine .

Service was a little slow. The place was empty besides maybe 1-2 other customers. Took far too long for water to hit our table. Had to ask for it after receiving out wine and after ordering everything.  The food came out just fine, the Bianco Flatbread wasn't amazing but it wasn't bad either. Just slightly bland to me. Had the chicken piccata which was really good but I felt like they overdid it a little on the lemon because all I could taste was lemon with a hint of chicken.

Server gave us the wrong kids meal for free. Didn't refill drinks or ask if everything was ok. He did bring my son's birthday sundae. Menu says kids desserts $1.00 but on the receipt says $2.50. He circled the bottom portion of the check that has the amount of tip we should leave, 15

First who doesn't love CPK's food. My girlfriend and I decided to eat here after our first choice was "closed". This was our first time eating at the waikiki location, they have an outside seating section with lounge, good cruising type of chairs as well as the normal tables. However we chose to eat inside, because of humidity we wanted to enjoy the AC. Of course we ordered the spinach artichoke dip, our favorite! With the chicken lettuce wraps, second favorite. For our entree we decided to share the artichoke spinach and chicken thin crust pizza. We shared one raspberry iced tea, free refills. Our server was very friendly he brought one raspberry iced tea for each of us after having to refill the one we were sharing several times.  While looking through the menu, I discovered CPK now has a rewards type if program called "Pizza Dough" it's an App. Available on the iPhones. Where you earn points for eating at there restaurants. So of course I downloaded and signed up, it's free. Just for signing up, I received a free coca cola and a free small plate. Our server used the free coca cola for our raspberry iced tea and we ordered a mushroom and spinach flat bread pizza ($6.49) which both were free just for signing up. Through the program, for every $100 you spend at their restaurants you receive a $5 gift certificate to use. Which is pretty cool, I don't know much restaurants that have a rewards program. For dessert we ordered the pumpkin cheesecake with a scoop of ice cream. That was delicious! I'm not sure how long they'll be having it available, but I would recommend it. Overall the service was great, the food was awesome. I would definitely recommend this location and any CPK in fact. Also don't forget to enroll in their program.

There are very few restaurants that cater to the gluten sensitive that being said CPK now makes a absolutely delicious and affordable gluten free pizza   And if you give them time they will turn it into any pizza on the menu !!!!!  Such a treat for someone who hasn't tasted a pizza in years ... So addicted now
U can say the price is really cheap, for 2 people dinner+desert is only 40+, consider its in Waikiki. Funny thing is they have Kong Pao spaghetti, totally CA style.

The Waikiki location was nice. Not super crowded, same great service we've come to expect from CPK. We got the Peking duck pizza (total hit with us), Hawaiian pizza (a bit disappointed in that choice), Moroccan chicken salad (el hubbo couldn't stop eating that one!) a frozen Mai tai and an IPA. Decent drink selection and enough interesting food choices to keep coming back for. Gotta save room for dessert next time- salted caramel cake?!

Tasty Krispy works pizza. Yummy avocado egg roll things. Kids fettuccuni was flavorless but 4yr old didn't complain. Service was a Tad slow but not annoying at all.  No Kama'aina discount but they still do 10% military.
Service sucks! It took the waiter 13 mins to even come to my table to say hi. Not crowded at all. 12noon lunch time. Would not come back and I LOVE CPK;-( not this one!
Good food, nice service. It's a chain, which isn't a bad thing, it was actually better than most chains that I have been to. Pizza was cooked well and the beers were large.

Always BEEN & always WILL be a fan of California Pizza Kitchen.  My boyfriend and I came here for lunch to celebrate our anniversary.  We were so stoke the garlic chicken pizza was back so we ordered that, along with spinach dip & pita bread.  Last but not least, we ordered the famous butter cake to top off our anniversary lunch.  BOMB DIGGITY in my mouth! I totally forgot the waiters name, but he was very friendly and nice.  Our order took quite a while to come, but he notified us once he knew of the back orders.  Way to catch our attention so we didn't get mad about it. They should serve different ice cream with the butter cake though.  I asked our waiter if Vanilla was the only choice of ice cream and he said yes.  I was disappointed, but it's okay..Vanilla goes with anything! Tipped him good =)

Stopped by for a quick bite to eat and we couldnt get over how good the food was. My husband had their club sandwich and it was amazing. I had their thai salad and it was very refreshing. My husband loved his sandwich so much he took half to go and ate it later at our hotel. There was not much of a wait to get in and the server even though the resto looked busy was super friendly and accomodating. Will def be back.

I had a horrible experience.  Our waiter absolutely sucked. And when we were obvious about how much he sucked, the other waiters just pretty much walked on by. But then again they were probably busy so I wont knock them for that.  It was EMPTY during the time I went. Maybe 3-4 other groups. Our waiter was probably only serving us. MAYBE another table. But our water was barely tended to. I had to wait.... wait.... wait again and more and then ask for water... then wait.... wait... and wait some more.  He was just an awkward skinny fella that couldn't crack a smile.  And their AVOCADO appetizers sucks. Barely any avocado. We told the guy that and he said there's not much he can do. Too much waiting.... too little action. One of the worst service i've gotten and I've actually had really good service with CPK...  Plus ALL the food we tried out sucked also... what's going on CPK? I'm hoping it was just bad timing and judgement on trying new food.

What do you call a SoCal girl that's from San Diego and hardly stepped foot into a CPK until Hawaii? I don't know. Lame? But lo and behold! I have waited until several check-ins to finally leave a review. A girlfriend and I decided to have an impromptu girls dinner night out and we wanted something not expensive but definitely laid back and trendy. This is the spot to be. Service was excellent from the very moment we walked into the door. There were no wait time when we came here (before the dinner rush) and we're seated immediately.  Our server was very prompt and didn't rush us. He and she were very informative as far as recommendations knew their way around the menu. The Food We were light eaters at that moment and had their Lettuce wraps which had mushrooms, water chestnuts and scallions tossed in their yummy sauce and of course a good amount of lettuce.You can either order them in chicken or shrimp or both. They are known for their excellent pizza but aside from their eclectic menu, they also have a "Lite Adventurer" section. We decided on the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine. I definitely loved the garlic sauce tossed with zucchini, fettuccine, parsley and Parmesan. A friend of mine decided she didn't want to have garlic breath and was able to request hers with light garlic. Our server never failed in remembering details and little customization we requested. I wanted extra garlic on mine! Since then I've been back every so often to try their pizza. I'm not a huge fan of tomato sauce on any of my pizza's, however,  I am a huge fan of their BBQ Chicken which had BBQ sauce, red onions and cilantro and lastly cheese. HEAVEN! Another time I've been here, I had to try their Garlic Cream Fettuccine. I can definitely taste the bite of the roasted garlic on their Parmesan cream sauce. Their menu is so eclectic that they even have gluten free pizzas (for some that like gluten free)... Here's your sign. Over all 5 stars are coming from excellent and friendly service, food and atmosphere. I will be back again.

Listen to the reviews the service here sucks. Placed an online order and received a text confirmation from them.  Showed up 30 mins later to cpk and apparently they were having system issues and did not receive our order. Instead of an apology they looked at us with a blank state asking what we would like to do. No sorry sir no discount no comp no nothing. Asked for the manager and got same reply system is down not our fault and walked off - d bag.  Waikiki needs to step up its pizza game in general and start coming up with alternatives - pizza my heart anyone?

CPK has a special place in my heart. The food is consistent, delicious and reasonably priced. I've only been to this particular Waikiki location a few times, every time at a non-peak meal hour.  The service here isn't as spectacular as it is at the Kahala location, but it isn't particularly bad either. I like that you have the option of sitting outside at this location, and that there is a relatively large "bar area" with high tables for people who just want a fast bite or to have a drink and watch a game.  My favorites include the BBQ chicken salad, the moroccan chicken salad, thai crunch salad and waldorf chicken salad. I also like the veggie sandwich with caesar salad, kung pao spaghetti and cedar plank salmon. Spinach artichoke dip is a much, not because its the best dip I've ever had, but because it brings back memories of high school days with my friends :) I also like the corn guacamole and chips. It's not that great of a deal for $5, but it's pretty good. Drink wise, the white sangria and mojitos are my faves. As are the refillable flavored iced teas and lemonades :) drooool.

Don't get me wrong, I love CPK.. but I wouldn't recommend coming to the one in Waikiki!  We had about a 20 min wait on a Sunday night.. which is not too bad.  But our service was horrible! It took about 10 min before we got our waters (which we had to ask for and remind them again).  Our server seemed to be busy with everyone else's orders.. and a little overwhelmed. But she apologized for the wait.  One thing that was good was our orders came in pretty fast.  But for some reason the artichoke dip which I usually order at the Ala Moana one, didn't taste as good :/. Everything else tasted fine.   I'm sticking to the Ala Moana location!

Okay seriously, this place brought back PEKING DUCK PIZZA.  And yes, yes.. sometimes I'm hating on Waikiki being filled with all the chains and super expensive shops that make my nose bleed just by window shopping. And yes.. hole-in-the-walls and mom-n-pop shops will always hold my heart so much so that I'd plow down all those stores in support of local and small businesses. But seriously it's PEKING DUCK PIZZA people. If you grew up with it you'd totally understand LOL.  Okay joking aside, this location is right on the main drag, but for some reason - maybe because it's not as visible as Cheesecake Factory or PF Changs - THERE AREN'T HORDES OF PEOPLE WAITING HERE (I tried waiting for Cheesecake before: 2hrs! And for the CPK in Ala Moana: 1 hr and 45 mins!!)  My roomie and I arrived at 7:05pm and went straight into a cushy booth! Imagine that! And our waiter was really nice and came by often *surprised face* Not like at Cheesecake where you have to stalk out your waiter like prey, just to get a refill on soda.  Their food is on par with your typical chain restaurants - pretty tasty, fatty as hell, and not the cheapest but also not crazy $$$$. What I like is that they offer something more unique than pasta and a burger so when I get my american food cravings, it's surprisingly a nice, quick option. And it's great for big groups too without having to wait 1303029 hours.

Good experience! We had nice service (at an off time of day), good food and reasonably priced yummy cocktails.  The thin crust pizza and thai chicken salad were both good.  Raspberry mango colada and mojito were both very good as well!

First of all...kama'aina discounts (15% off - (For you non-Locals it's a local discount..you can try to get it but they will know you aren't local if you butcher the word itself)). YES The CPK at Ala Moana doesn't even do that!  Ok second of all if you haven't had a chance to try the Cidar Plank Salmon...I don't know what's wrong with you. It's amazing! It's salmon that is cooked in their open stove fire hearth which is amazing and served with succotash with feta cheese. I recommend taking the sweet route with this one and pairing it with Moscato D'Asti. Yeah yeah you big tough guys might be thinking to yourself, "Nah I'm going to drink a beer with it." DON'T YOU DARE! Seriously it's so good though and for 18.90 not bad at all. For dessert don't bother getting anything but Butter Cake. You think I'm joking but I'm not. It's so good they don't even bother putting up a description for it. Yeah it's that good. It's even better with the vanilla ice cream. The best server and the only server I request when I'm there is Melanie. I love this chick. She is so attentive and I've been going here for years...we have established a repertoire with her per say and it's amazing! I give this place 5 stars because quite frankly they get it right time and time again! I always recommend coming before 7pm or it gets crazy!!

Worst server ever, food is good but had the server from hell. She told me to order the Caesar salad because I didn't want onions, salad came loaded with diced onions, she takes it back. Order pizza with no onions, come with large onions on it, no big deal I can pull them off, she puts it down & says oh I'm sure you don't want it because it has onions, I will take it back really nasty. I was thinking take it  back you little B, run up your food costs. I did survey after, nobody responded so they will never see another dime from my onion face ever again

This CPK is on the smaller side with a venue that mirrors that of most all of the CPKs around the country but I knock this place a few stars for its service and size. A group of my friends and I received very slow service along with the tasking effort it took for us to get seated because of the restaurants minuscule seating capacity. The food was good and the environment was nice especially if you want to sit outside because you do get the pizzazz of the Waikiki strip. I knock it a few stars because it is a chain and the food is nearly identical to all of the other restaurants, so the service should outshine the food. Overall it should get a 2.5 if it was possible because of the surrounding atmosphere. Give it a shot and see if the service has a more positive vibe for you.

Went there for a birthday party with a group of 11. Had no reservations but got seated pretty quick for how busy it was! Host was very nice and did a good job! Now understand I go to cpk at ala moana very often and I love it! After getting seated we ordered drinks, 3 of our drinks didn't even come out also with no bread! Put in an appetizer and it came out pretty quick! Was a little cold but still okay! It was the Chinese dumplings! Still no bread came out! We kept asking but I don't know what was going on! I ordered the garlic chicken and shrimp Alfredo for dinner because that's what I always get and I was surprised to say that it sucked! Nothing like the one from the thee cpk!  Waikiki cpk has terrible servers and the food is not good at all! If your visiting Hawaii don't go to the cpk in Waikiki go to ala moana or kahala malls ones!

Went to cpk in Waikiki for a friends birthday with a party of 11 and the service we received was terrible. I expected to wait a while to be seated because we had a large group and Waikiki restaurants are known to be busy.  But after we were seated, our waters and drinks took so long to come out and we didn't get one water refilled throughout our dinner. We also asked for bread from our waitress in the beginning and because she forgot, asked another server. The bread didn't end up coming out until after our entrees came and after reminding our server twice.  I don't know if it was the slow service that ruined my taste buds, but I felt that the food wasn't even that good. I always get the original BBQ pizza and i always leave satisfied. However, this time I felt like it was made rushed and something was left out because It didn't taste the same. I felt like the cpk at ala moana tastes much better with more flavor and definitely has better service than what we got in Waikiki.  If you have a choice to go to a cpk, I personally would choose to go to the one at ala moana because of this experience. I also feel like the pricing is raised because of the location in Waikiki. Parking is also easier at ala moana than on the Waikiki strip.

Very nice place! Seated us out on the lanai with a great view of Waikiki.  Lit tiki torches added nicely to the ambiance.  We started off with the avocado fried spring rolls, super tasty! I had the chipotle chicken pizza that had the perfect amount of spiciness! All the food brought out to us was perfectly cooked. Waitress was very nice and attentive. Always keeping our drinks full and our questions answered. They no long have the Kama'aina discount but they do have a Military one! I recommend the mango ice tea, real good, but ask for half the syrup because it's pretty sweet.  I'd definitely come back again.

Wish we could put zero stars on this. We visited on 414 2014. We ordered thin crust pizza. It was the worst pizza we've ever had in her life the crust was not crispy at all. It was like eating cardboard for crust.  this makes frozen pizza look really good. We do not recommend this CPK and will never eat another CPK again!!

Was here yesterday and the food and service was great.  beer was ice cold and food was delish!!! good for kids.  we live in Waikiki so this place is walking distance for us.  always no wait unlike the other CPKs and we arrived at 6:45pm!

My husband and just wanted a late night snack and drink.....so we went to one of our favorite restaurants.   But this time we were very disappointed.  We sat in the bar area.  It took awhile for someone to even greet us.  Finally when someone came my husband was upset and started asking the people next to us if the service been slow.  Our waiter heard came back to us to make excuses....oh long day.....blah blah blah.  Didn't hear a word.  Any way we got our appetizer before our cocktail.  Our view was dirty dishes on the table in front of us which no body bother to clean up.  The employees sat on that table and just kept moving the dirty dishes on the side.  While counting their money and talking story.  We decided to leave not ordering another drink.  While leaving no body was by the podium but the manager yelling from across the restaurant thank you.  I would not seat on the bar tables again.

Food is ok as always. Today im writing a review about service.  Im actually sitting here still. Service is really slow. The first waiter that got our drink orders was slow.. he actually never came back to give us our drinks. And then a girl comes along, I think shes a manager or something, she took our order,  brought out our drinks. And then she and one other waiter checked on us ONCE. Our food came out, all but 1... our salad. Waited about 15 mins and then flagged down this other guy to check up on it. He brought it out.   Then we continued eating.. no one checked up on us.. altho they walked past us every 2 minutes. Nothing. Just sitting here, waiting for someone to come so we can wrap things up and get our check. :/  Everything was goood, service was just bad. Sorry.. asked for our pizza togo.. waited 10 minutes and never got it so decided to leave

Really a pity - such nice sounding options, but the quality is low. * the white pizza was cold, mascarpone cheese flavorless. **  Grilled peach salad - peaches looked to be out of a can rather than grilled.  * Salted caramel pudding - hmmm .... this might have been invented by children - like eating caramel sauce on crushed Oreos ...

Hostess was rude, waitress was also rude, the only nice one was the guy who brought our food out and we waited for 40 mins and there were 5 or 6 tables open bc the host forgot about us. Not worth coming to!

Great place for a beer and some after snacks. Staffs here are great and have great services.  4 types of beer on tap. There is long board,  blue moon, budlight,  and ipa. Friendly and appreciate everyone that comes in. Kudos to all

We have eaten at California Pizza Kitchen twice since we've been in Honolulu and have been extremely pleased both times. The hostess, our waitress, and the manager were all incredibly pleasant, engaging, and polite; and they were genuine about it, not fake.  The white corn and guacamole appetizer is very good, the pizzas, chicken and pasta, fish tacos, and club sandwich are all awesome!  The cost is very reasonable considering the location, view for people watching, and quality of their food and staff.

The food was good but not a good as the Ala Moana branch. I wouldn't go back and that is because the service was terrible. The place was almost empty when we were seated, no server appeared, eventually a Casey came and stropped to our table and acted like a moody teenager who didn't want to be there as she served us. We waited for nearly 15 minutes for our drinks, our pizza took ages and we were not given the complimentary bread. If I wasn't on holiday I would have tipped zero and talked to the manager, by the time it came to leave we were over it and pretty shocked by the service. It the worst service in Hawaii and I haven't had issues like this anywhere in the world. It very much seemed that no one was in control and no team work was happening.

At first I really thought we'd get crappy service, it took a little bit, then all of a sudden we got a fella named Kojun and quite possibly we got the best service we've received since we been on Oahu. I would have given 5 stars but the pre-Kojun was not satisfying. Especially seeing 20% of tables open and told we would have to wait to be seated.

We enjoy good food and don't usually mind prices. On Oahu after many over priced restaurants with poor service CPK is a breath fresh air.  Everyone from manager to bassboy very friendly, helpful, pizza tastes great and served fast. One of the best pizzas actually, I've ever ate. And that coming from NYC! Highly recommend for casual dinner with friends/family/kids!
Shows duck pizza on menu at door, not on menu inside. Pizza I got was not up to quality of what I'd had before at other California pizza. Very disappointed.

Server was super cool but my bf ordered pasta and it made him throw up after about 4 bites he threw up in his plate and we told and showed our server and he took it away so we asked for our bill and wanted the pasta taken off because it made him throw up and he only took 4 bites so I guess our server told his manager and the manager told the server that he would have to pay for it with his own $!! In what world dose that make any sense that's bad customer service so this is a review for bad management if someone threw up and I was a manager I would have went right to that table and asked if I could do anything to help I didn't see the manager at all! and why would I make them pay for something that made them sick?

Sat at the bar. I come here once a week. Great food and service. Bartenders make good conversation and it's a nice environment overall. Kitchen is clean and seems that employees take good care of the food prep area. Wish there were a few more drink specials though. Had the tostada pizza and it was delicious.

Okay we came here only because everywhere else was busy the wait was an hour or more, and here it was only about 15 mins so we decided to stay plus our kids were tired and hungry. If i didnt want to slap the three girls at the hostess station, they were so rude flying paper around real unprofessional. When we asked to put our name down they just rolled their eyes and were mumbling to eachother like talking crab, like if you cant handle your job then Quit!! And ya it was busy but they should really learn how to have better customer service. But dont get me wrong cuz i love cpk i usually go to the pearl ridge side because im from that side. But waikiki's cpk i dont recommend anyone to this one service is really shitty!  Plus im a waitress at a different joint, i know what it takes to have customer service. This is the worst cpk i ever been to.

Had lunch with a friend here today, and we ordered a California Chicken Club (her) and the Italian Deli Sandwich w/a Cesar Salad (me)...both were delicious.  We saved room for dessert (Butter Cake), which our solid server, Jacob, recommended we try with fresh strawberries and strawberry compote.  We enjoyed delicious food, attentive and friendly service, and an all-around great time.  We'll be back.

Fabulous dinner with friends! We enjoyed "half" salads that were huge! And shared pizzas.  The food was great, but the best part was Beau, our server. Despite a full dinning room, he was very attentive and so sweet!  If you go, request to be in his section!

I've been in that place a couple of times.  I must say it is the best pizza and pasta I've ever had.  Our servers Christian and Christina were amazing , they had a way of being in top of you ,checking on you without being annoying. Service was fast and the kitchen was fast as well.  At last learn to separate the kitchen service and the floor service. I'm a restaurant manager in New York for fine dinning restaurants and trust me it really makes a difference. You can't say slow service and affect the waiter when the kitchen is slow or the opposite.  Overall what will the waiter bring you at the table if there is no food from the kitchen to bring????! Definitely visit the place and I'm sure all waiters are great along with the kitchen. I'm just sharing my personal experience.  Enjoy!!!
Quality pizza, great staff , good choice of beer and great service. Plus free wifi. I'm a pizza snob. I love trying different kinds if pizza and love a choice. This place delivers on that.

Was eating here tonight sitting at bar having a great dinner but couldnt help but notice one of the chefs kept eating bread of some sort with butter or some topping while prepping food that goes out to tables..thats putting his bare hands food to mouth then bare hands handling food products going out to customers..very gross and very bad..it was not once but atleast 3 times..

I like CPK and I'm a regular customer. I usually go to the one in Kahala and I love it there. The servers are awesome and the food's always great. Yesterday, I went to the Waikiki location. I was beyond upset and disappointed. My mom's high school classmates came here to visit and we decided to take them to try CPK. When our food came, the portions of salad and lettuce wraps were noticeably smaller than the ones at Kahala and Ala Moana. I'm, honestly, not the type of person that wants to complain or argue at the restaurant, so it was fine. Until, I noticed that the Chicken Picatta I ordered never arrived. So, of course, I would ask about it. It took several tries to call our waitress, Danielle, over. I understand that CPK is busy, but it probably took almost 10 minutes to call her over. Usually at Kahala, we have to wait almost an hour to get in. We didn't even have to wait for a table at 7:00 PM, so it was not NEARLY as busy as Kahala. When we tried to get the attention of other staff to ask our waitress to come over, they simply ignored us. Finally, when she came over, we told her our order never came, and her reply was "Oh, it didn't come?" Then, she said she would check on it. No "sorry" or anything. By that time, we were almost done with our meal and I didn't want it anymore, it took another several tries to get her over. In the end, my mom just stood up and walked over to tell her. I just wanted to leave by then. When the bill came, we checked it and GUESS WHAT? The Chicken Picatta was still included on the bill. When I finally got her attention, she nodded her head and probably came back 3 minutes later. Before I could say a word, she snatched the bill, placed a new one down, and said "Sorry bout that" (with attitude) and walked away. She obviously knew there was something wrong with the bill because she brought the new one over before I even told her. I was furious. We payed and left. I've always loved CPK for their amazing servers, but I guess not all the servers are amazing. My mom's friends were wearing touristy kind attire and since they're not from here, we didn't speak English. If they're taking advantage of foreign customers, who might not be aware of the bill and wrong charges, that's outrageous. I regret not talking to the manager, because that was one of my worst experiences at a restaurant ever. I am never coming back to the Waikiki CPK.

I am happy to report that I have snapped my dining at restaurants with no customers streak. :-) CPK was about 25% full at noon today. Had lunch at CPK today, sat at a large table and had plenty of room to spread out. For some reason I always order the same thing: Fettuccine Alfredo.  Since I am trying to cut down decided to split the meal and add a dinner salad. The food is consistent and the service was attentive, but a little off.  Had to ask for bread plates because the server brought the bread and we had nothing in front of us for it. Also had to request a fork because only one is set and it was taken with the salad plate. The hostess was cute when she politely asked if it would be ok if she packaged the remaining salad and entree in the kitchen--Yes please! Only other remarkable thing about the experience was the very comfortable air conditioning. Glad to feel that the management is not economizing at the detriment of customer enjoyment.
The restaurant is located upstairs. The food is the same as any other CPK. You will probably get seated faster than you would at the nearby Cheesecake Factory.

Service was kinda slow at first we waited about 15-20 min for anybody to ask for drinks or whatever so we had to ask a waitress passing by if someone was assigned to our table. She said she could take our order so she was nice. pizza was ok,  fish taco was meh.

Relatively crowded, but it seems you could always be seated more quickly at the bar. Friendly staff. Had the ravioli - would not recommend it since it seemed to be from a frozen package. Stick to the salads and pizzas.
Service is good workers at the bar are great! Don't ever order pizza to go. It's so hit and miss. You either get a burnt or under cooked and cold pizza. CPK no good for take out!
Service was fine until our server asked us if we could hurry and pay so he could go on break. And we weren't even done yet

I'm in love with the Thai crunch salad and the spicy chipotle chicken pizza! My husband believes the bbq chicken pizza is superb! Their drinks are ok. I really love that if there is a long waiting line, you can easily head to the bar area and have a seat and eat :)  We will return! (We have a couple of times)

We went there with friends to have lunch on Sunday.  They had just opened and we were seated quite fast. Thecwait staff was very friendly and attentive. I had the Thai Chicken Crunch salad. I had the half salad and it was very tasty. My friend's all had different voews on their orders.  The decor is very inviting and upbeat. And tgey have a full size bar.  You can order cocktails to go with your meals.  I would recommend this location to both locals and tourist. ..

Love cpk food, but came for take out here and the corner to pick up is right by the only entrance to kitchen and bathrooms. Very bottlenecked and ppl constantly bumping into each other. Manager should consider flow more with such a busy location.

I was so furious I made this review. At exactly after I didn't get any service at this location. I arrived at the waikiki location at 1:00 and was seated right away. It wasn't even busy and no one even came to drop off water or even stop by to say they will help us in a minute.  We just sat there for about 15 mins with no help and the worst part was there was about 6-8 people at the cash register. There were some people making contact with us, but no help at all they knew we were ready as i waved my hand for help but ignored. I will never eat at this disappointment location ever again. All the other location at pearlridge alamoana were not even this horrid being as busy as they are. I made this review right after i left. I also never make reviews and i can understand somewhat coming from the services industry.  But no assistance 15 mins plus everyone was looking at our direction. Sigh what a waste of time making this review out of disaapointment and waste of time going there...
Great pizza.  Solid GF options.  Price is right. Location great.  Well worth the stop.  Salad wrap (shrimp) was awesome!

Our server Dylan talked us into trying the stuffed chili relleno & Berry Sparkler. Stuffed Chili was spicy but had a lot of flavor, thankful for the berry sparkler! It was a great combo we will have again! Hubby liked the pizza crust so we will be comming back :)

Dined in for a change.  We were seated right away, though we didn't have reservations at 12:10 p.m.  Our waithelp was pleasant, but inattentive.  We had to constantly flag him down: 1) needed bread and olive oil, 2) needed refills on soda, 3) needed to order dessert, 4) needed bill so we could get back to work!  If not for the slow, inattentive service, it would have been a nice dining experience! I usually do take-out and it's ready or I have CPK deliver and it's never a problem.  But dining in was a bad idea this time! The food was great!  I tried the fennel sausage flatbread, which is affordable and just the right amount for me!  And I tried the new salted caramel dessert.  It wasn't too sweet, but just right with crispy chocolate cookies under the caramel pudding and whipped cream!  Ono!
CPK is so tasty because it's fresh and I like pizza.Its also good because it has $0.99 kids desert that my parents always eat!

Whoa, NO BUENO CPK. What happened to you guys?   Had dinner at CPK and things didn't go well. The place wasn't that crowded (got crowded just as we were leaving, but until then it wasn't bad) (Just realized after posting this review, that we weren't even offered a complimentary bread with olive oil.  We never got it.  Would have flagged down our server if we had realized) First, friend and I ordered Crispy Mac N Cheese to share.  Server brought over the plate very quickly.  I cut one of them in half, and the middle is still hard as a rock and COLD.  Uh, no.  Cut another in half - same thing.  The macaroni and the cheese was dry (and not melty cheesy like usual).  Do they just nuke this in the microwave before serving? Are the pre-made?  Not sure what's up.  Returned the dish to our server and I watched him bring it back to the kitchen area and he was talking directly to one of the cooks about the cold frozen Mac N Cheese.  I had wished he had brought this to a manager's attention because no one came to our table to discuss this.      Received our second try of Crispy Mac N Cheese - this time it was hot, but again, I have had better Crispy Mac N Cheese at other CPK's (where the cheese was soft and melted with macaroni that wasn't dry) - quality control anyone? Second, the Spaghetti with Bolognese was bland - had to use a ton of salt, and the pasta was overcooked.  Really overcooked.  Third, my friend's pizza was only luke warm when it got to our table - and actually the crust turned cold after a couple of minutes.  What gives? No refill on our sodas until it was almost time to ask for the check. Tip for our server was falling down down downnnn by the minute. May have to go to CPK at Kahala Mall, Kailua or at Ala Moana Center from now on.
We came here cause there's a short wait. While Ala MOANA and Pearlridge has a 30-45 minute wait time, here we got seated immediately. The food is the same and service is good too.

Very disappointed with food and service here. Came around 11:30am on Wednesday it was empty. Ordered spinach artichoke dip chips look like it came from bottom of the bag. Had to ask server for bread. After we finished eating had to waitvanptherv15-20 minutes to get check and wrap up leftovers. I could understand if they were busy but the weren't. Will not be coming to this location again.

A different take on Classic American dishes and pizzas. The option for choosing whole wheat and/or thin crust on the pizzas is great. We had the Margherita and the Works - flavourful ingredients and super delicious. The indoors seating is a bit cold and dull, but the attitude of the staff is positive and makes up for it.

1. VERDICT/VALUE Good food, reasonably priced (for Waikiki), with a view to boot if you get seated on the lanei! 2. FOOD  The complementary four pieces of baguette-type bread and olive oil starts the dining experience. Tonight, we started with the Asparagus & Arugula Salad ($5.99): light dressing and cheese shavings make this a great beginning... The California Club pizza ($14.69) featured a thin but soft crust.  It feels healthy since there's little or no sauce and it's light on bacon and chicken - you really feel more like you're eating arugula, Romaine lettuce and avocado in every slice. The Jambalaya Fettuccine ($18.39) featured lots of big shrimp, bits of ham and crawfish, and Andouille sausage slices. It's great (and not spicy), but it's small for the price. Of note beverage-wise, the Peach Ice Tea ($3.29) is a little weak but at least refillable; I recommend going with the mango iced tea! 3. SERVICE We had Kaylee who was awesome: food came out at a reasonable rate, drinks were refilled without asking and she was always checking in. My fellow Yelpers seemed to have experienced up-and-down service; we've never had an issue on any visit, but your mileage may vary.   4. ATMOSPHERE Like other CPK's out there - it's modern and clean.  The second floor lanei seating overlooking Kalakaua is the one you want (unfortunately you can't make reservations for groups out there).  It's a good place to go any time of day, but the later afternoon and evening (when the tiki torches are lit) are likely your best bets.

It was quite busy and there is no actual waiting area, people were crowded outside. We got seated in a booth near the bar and approached in a timely manner.  Initially, the waitress (Heather) was very attentive. My son started with a kids Sundae for 99 cents - he loved it. My daughter ordered a half Caesar salad and kids pizza. Husband ordered a chicken pasta dish, and I ordered chicken piccata.  We got our spinach and artichoke dip at the same time as the ice cream. The dip is awesome. The waitress was on it with refilling drinks.  My husband was unhappy with his dish as he had about 4-5 small pieces of chicken in his pasta. Daughter loved the salad. I loved my piccata dish.  It all went down hill as our waitress took long to bring my sons pizza and the tiramisu dessert.  I would eat there again, the husband will not.

Dylan was great. He made the whole experience amazing. He was personal, considerate, and recommended so many different options. He made me feel like the most important person in the world. I'll definitely be coming back! You're the best Dylan!
Very nice place. The waiter was very friendly and recommended great meals. First time eating there and it was very good. I will most definitely go back.

We went to the Waikiki cpk and found out they didn't offer the kama'aina discount anymore but that was ok. The wait is much shorter compared to other cpk's. The only other hassle is the parking in Waikiki. When a table became available they asked us if outside would be ok. I said sure and the hostess walked us out to a recently cleared table. The table had been cleared but had not been wiped down. I asked the hostess if they could wipe the table down and she called the bus boy over who wiped half of the table but missed where it was still wet and dirty. I told the hostess and she rolled her eyes back at me and was very impatient like as if this was my fault that the chairs and the table still had food from the previous customers. She stormed away while we waited for the bus boy to come back. I could not believe what we were experiencing. She was a local Asian girl and I thought she would be more receptive to locals but maybe she was having a bad night.  I'm in a customer service industry and its important that you don't take your frustrations out on your guests.   Our waitress came over and introduced herself to us. She was very nice. She had red hair and her name was Kaylee. I'm not sure if I am spelling her name correctly. She was so pleasant and professional but most import, very very friendly! Her service was excellent. She brought our food out on a timely basis. She always made sure we were ok and brought back a refill for my daughter when her sprite was low. We had a glass of the Cabernet which was nice. I don't remember the name of it but it was smooth. For our appetizer, we ordered the chicken lettuce wraps. For some reason, the Waikiki one tasted way better than the other locations. I'm not sure if they make it different but wow, it was excellent! We also ordered the Mac and cheese, penne pasta, and the Sicilian pizza. Everything was great! Kaylee brought the food out while it was nice and hot and always checked on us yo make sure we were ok or needed anything else.. She made the rest of our experience at CPK very enjoyable! Even though i have to pay for parking, I would go back to Waikiki CPK, just because of Kaylee. She is definitely an asset to CPK!  By the way, even though They don't do Kama'aina discounts anymore, they do military discount which is still very nice!

Most ghetto CPK Ive been too. I sat at the bar because the wait was ridiculous. My chips were stale. My fetti wasn't worth $15. My bartender was a complete klutz and kept dropping glasses. He stuck his fingers in a couple drinks too because the garnishes fell in, Im glad I didn't order any drinks there.  The plates looked so old and used out. The waiter/bartender fucked up my bill. LOL I wont be back, so gross.
I have a great dinner there, but the waiting time of pizza was a little longer. By the way, the waiter was very cute and nice!

Pizza was average at best, the location is what makes this place acceptable.  Drinks were priced on par with local bars.  Drink orders took a while to come out even though there was not many people in the restaurant.

I will NEVER visit this location again.  My daughter and I attempted to eat here on Saturday for lunch, but no one ever came to our table to service us.  There were people sitting in our area being checked on constantly, but the waiter/waitress never assisted us.  2 thumbs down...
Not bad.  Had hawaiian pizza.  It was good since I was hungry.  Not interested in going back or to another location state side.
The Sicilian pizzas and avocado egg rolls were bomb, great service.

I go to this CPK all the time and it's always excellent.  The food is tasty and the service is friendly; it's what you've come to expect from this chain.   A word of caution, however.  This location is in the heart of Waikiki and as a result is very busy during peak hours. (6pm-8:30pm)  If you come during this time and/or have a larger party you will likely have to wait. TIP:  If there's only two people in your party, consider eating at the bar.  There usually isn't a wait and watching them make the pizza is a great source of entertainment. Some dishes to try: For the pizza lover - the Original BBQ Chicken For something meatier - the Meat Cravers (Thin Crust Pizza) For something different - the Spaghetti Bolognese For something healthier - the Waldorf Chicken Salad For dessert - the Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake TIP: Don't forget the bread and olive oil!  They should ask you if you want it but if not then let them know.  The bread is served warm and the olive oil has herbs and spices in it.  Yum!

Let me start by saying the food is AMAZING! Plus the prices are very realistic. Very good service very little wait time even though we didn't book and overall the experience is great.  Let me just say one thing about the waiters and as far as tipping goes. For some reason waiters from all around Waikiki expect that you tip them 20% of the bill all the time everytime. This as you can imagine is very hard to do if your eating out day in day out especially with a large family. Needless to say we left a tip of $5 cash as we were paying by card and had no other cash to offer and the waiter was very attentive and friendly up until that point. Once she put the credit card through she basically threw the bill back to us without even saying thank you or goodbye. I found that very rude as she was more than friendly two mins prior to this. Employees seem to forget that we also work for our money so it's not always easy to throw 20% of the bill around on tips 3 times a day for two weeks. Please rectify this issue with employees cpk as if it wasn't for that one rude gesture this review would of been 5 stars As the food is simply amazing!   That won't stop me from going back though
One of the best restaurants I've ever been to in my life. The food is amazing! And the customer service is great! Truly recommend this place if you ever come to Waikiki.
