CARRY OUT review... Got take out one night while staying in Waikiki. The order was ready quickly and staff was friendly. Food was too be expected. We had the Hawaiian pizza and chopped salad. Dressing on chopped salad was tasty! Ordered a sprial Mac and cheese for my daughter which was a large portion (she's 16 mos) and lasted many meals. Also it wasn't too cheesy. Pretty good for a child's meal.

Great restaurant friendly staff.  Our waiter was very helpful in what to order and even recommended other restaurants in the area for fresh hawaii fish.  Thank you.  Love restaurant chains that keep the brand on point.

I ate here twice and the food was good and the service great.  The waiters are super attentive and very respectful.  I sat at the bar (they do serve alcohol) but I wish they had bar-like seating overlooking Kalakua Avenue as it is upstairs and would be a nice option.  There are a few TVs if you want to watch sports but only in one section closer to the bar and high-tops.  Good place.

I sat at the counter & one of the wait staff approached me to advise that the bartender would be right with me.  He even retrieved my  beverage for me!  Great teamwork & customer service !  The food is always consistently good and the variety of choices is excellent.

I liked that there was no wait! We got seated right away. Good food. We had the cedar salmon, jambalaya and tequila chicken pasta. All were tasty. My son followed his meal with a slice of red velvet cake & Hagen Daz ice cream!

Was there last week on vacation and the service was terrible, TERRIBLE. Wow. Our waiter was friendly, however, either he was drunk or high. He messed up our order not one, not two, not three, four times! He didn't remember who ordered what drink. He never brought straws (he had to ask another waiter).  When we go our pizza the dishes he brought were dirty! I wish I would've taken pictures. A semi blind person would've noticed that. We told another waitress and she took them and brought us clean one and didn't even apologize or wasn't grossed out or surprised. The plates had Scrapped up food on them.  This is the worse service I have ever experienced. Perhaps they know we are tourist and we are not coming again anyways. Just asked my mom what else happened... "No utensils, they wanted us to eat outside (bc they had a party coming in) it was 90 degrees outside." Our waiter was the only nice one but he was completely out of it. So many mistakes we figured out he was drunk.  The manager was rude (ignored us) when we entered and had someone else help us.  Never again.

come here every year on our vacation. Big disappoinment this year! ordered Lettuce wrapped dish for group of 8 for appetizing, waiter brought out with 2 leaves of lettuce, then he realized it does not enough and brought us extra 2 leaves of lettuces, what kind of lettuce wrapped dish is that? they need to take this off their menu

During this particular visit to CPK, I ordered the bar-b-que chopped salad. Turned out to be a huge mistake, my stomach was extremely upset for the rest of my vacation! Don't order the salad, or better yet don't eat their period.

5 stars for our awesome waiter/store bartender. This location really gives you the "Aloha" feeling! Every single worker was polite and caring! I can't remember our waiter's name (I'm bad with names- good with faces) but he was very cool and knowledgable. I am a little picky with my food and when we had to take something back- he was totally fine with that.  I highly recommend this location. I am all about customer service and this location has it! When we left- everyone said "goodbye & mahalo!"  Pros Food-  My fiancé ordered a pepperoni pizza. It was seasoned well and had a good pep to cheese ratio. The crust was great too! Thanks Chef Peter!  I ordered the California Club on Ciabatta bread- I was a little apprehensive at first because ciabatta bread is usually hard as a rock when ordered at restaurants- but not here. The bread had a nice crunch with a soft center. The turkey was seasons well also! I would definitely order this sandwich again!  Con- The salad that came with my salad. The romaine lettuce was limp and did not have any crispy crunch to it.
Appetizer came out fast. I loved it. Spinach and artichoke dip was great. My friend got a tortilla soup as well. We then shared a pizza. Great. Josh was a hottie. He made the experience better.
Had a wait; but it was fine.  Food was good - they have a new arugula/quinoa salad...add the shrimp and you have a perfect little meal!  Service was good.  Ambience nice!

Although at first we were upset at the service we had with the hosts, apparently our buzzer didn't work and there were about 3 parties that went before us, our server Charlene was really awesomely sweet right from the start. She literally turned our frowns upside down. She's a bundle of joy and a great server! This is why I'm giving it a 5 star if it wasn't for her I would've given a 1 at least a 2 for the food. Thank you Charlene for your hard work! As for CPK....fix your buzzers! And train your hosts to be more professional!
The service was slow to start but they soon kicked into gear by delivering the appetisers and entrées together - what the!! Anyway, the food was OK but nothing to rave about.  Much better around.

The food was pretty good here the pizzas were really good excellent thin crust highly recommend the mushroom pizza. Requires a certain taste though not a restaurant for everyone, but the service was horrible the waiter was extremely rude, and not helpful at all in trying to accommodate the customer.

Let's start off on a good note!  We did a call ahead and got seated fast.... (That's all)  I've never had a bad experience at a CPK before. We sat at our table for close to 10mins before being greeted. Our server look at our table 3 times before coming to us with drink napkins. When taking our drink menu we insisted on placing our food order because the timing to be greeted took awhile and we were unsure on when he would be back. Arthur, our server who took long and doesn't clean as he goes.  As a server, when you drop drinks off, you pick up dirty dishes, cups, plates or napkins that are visibly finished. (See picture for better understanding.  We had to ask for everything without being offer, even as much as napkins and a glass of water. It even took more then 10mins for a refill on my drink and then was lied to saying they ran out of lemonade and he had to make more. (I watched as he poured my drinks along with a table top of 6's drinks.  --hint: don't try to lie when it's an open restaurant-- All in all, if he's been a server and just didn't finish training, he should probably go back to it for the basic.

Had an amazing meal with my brother and nephew. My nephew being three years old was soo picky every where in WIKIKI but when he had the mac n cheese here he said it was the beat day ever. DYLAN was an amazing waiter! so friendly with a grade A smile. he took great care of us and was very attentive for how slammed he was. definitely will be back here. Keep up the great service, Dylan.

We are visiting family here and we came from what's, CPK isn't new to us, we just wanted a quick dinner to finish up a day of long travels, Lorenzo was our server and he was absolutely fantastic! He made everything about the kids, while they were too busy watching Netflix we as parents really appreciated it. He was on it with everything! Thanks Lorenzo!

Convenient location as it's on the strip but not worth the wait.  The hawaiian pizza was less than satisfying. Canned pineapple slices with cold cut ham - 6 slices for $15. The crispy Mac and cheese was decent.  Got our meal to go and the waitress didn't supply any napkins or utensils.  When we went back to ask,  she also forgot to give us our bread.  Very disappointed.  Don't call yourself a pizza place if you can't even do hawaiian pizza properly.

Went there with my wife and kids, had a great experience. Food was good, but it was all about the service. Lorenzo is the man! he know how to handle families, priorities service for kids, frequent checks of the table to ensure all is well. And it wasn't just me, this was being delivered consistently throughout his section, even offering points of interest tips for guests visiting from out of town.  thanks Lorenzo!

Really disappointing.  Service was ok. We arrived around 430 so the place was empty. They had kids menus and crayons which always helps. The place is very tired though and smelled a little musty.  The food .... There is 'cheesy bread' which is a super crisp pizza sort of base with a few blobs of cheese and a lot of parmesan. Very salty and not much else. We shared the Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza which could have very well been a frozen pizza. Same texture and flavour and not nearly enough sauce.  Beer was served with an orange slice .. Which is just weird.  Would not recommend unless you're desperate.
Mediterranean veggie salad and grilled veggie tortilla wraps w/sauce were the best.  Plus they have Blue Moon on tap. However, service was very slow. Waited about 10 mins for my drink.
Holy butter cake! Don't leave without trying it! Pizza was delicious as well! Great service, super cheap meal for Waikiki area. Will return!

Service was awesome...but the food was gross. Seriously. Gross. The "pulled chicken" in my California Club was just cold, flavorless cubes smothered in half a jar of mayonnaise. The bread was stale and the bacon was burnt.  I wish I could give more stars because the service was legit great but no one should eat here unless they're enjoy nausea.

I have been to several CPK's in Oahu. Kalaha Mall, Pearl Ridge Mall, Ala Moana Mall and Kalakaua Ave location. The Garlic Creme Pasta with Chicken is the only dish I order and I must say, each location is very consistent with the flavor, juicy chicken and presentation. My server "Brooke" for the afternoon welcomed the table with a bright smile, courtesy attitude and luminous laughter. This restaurant is a must for clean, healthy and a welcoming environment. I will be coming back again soon. And for those not local to the United States, tip is greatly appreciated. Brooke will receive a generous one!!!

Cpk is just one of those places that usually hits the spot on a random day out.  They offer a wide selection of pizzas, salads, pastas and sandwiches.   I enjoy them for their thin crust pizzas similar to New York Style.  But what they offer is so much more than the traditional slice on the street.  I personally enjoy the wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil.   What's also great about them is that their pizzas are more than enough to share for two maybe even three if you eat light.  Match it with a salad or appetizer:  I go for the spinach dip (average) or the avocado rolls.   I personally enjoy their change a number of years ago for their bread. Gone are the days of the bread that was stale on the outside and butter that ripped the bread to shreads.  Now they have a sort of artisan bread; crisp and paired with olive oil and seasoning. Great starter without ordering.  This time I had the Vegetarian Sandwich (foccaccio bread with portebello, vegetables with sun dried tomato aioli).  A great meal for two or for a snack later.   The atmosphere is nice and has a darker or dimly lit feel. I think it's wonderful for business meetings or to simply hang out with friends. Gets completely away from the sand and sun right outside for Waikiki beach but it's good to take a break from the sun too.  There is outdoor seating as well if you want the sun and people to watch (one of my favorite past times).   Wait service normally great but I believe they were unsure with us conducting business. As my business associate mentioned they are normally great; so chalk it up as a random occurrence. Parking is an issue in the area but if you're already here then it's all good. Note, you have an escalator going up and steps going down only. There is an elevator not top far from the steps.  Atmosphere 4/5  Food - 4/5 Service - 4/5 Parking - 2/5

The service was ok, but they refused to do a split pizza for me when all of the other CPK's on the island will do it...the server later came and explained that they cannot do it because they are a higher volume store and they have to pre make some of their pizzas. Understandable but still a little inconvenient & wish they had the option!

I liked the red sangria that we got here... it tasted pretty good. The California Club is a really healthy and tasty pizza. I also had the mushroom, pepperoni, & sausage pizza which was alright. This place is good. Like any California Pizza Kitchen...  Service was normal.

Its official.  I really dislike this location.  Not only because the inside looks like a cheap cafeteria with dim lighting, a lack of windows, and horrid booth coverings, but because the staff's level of professionalism, except for our server Dennis, is akin to little kids running the show.  The sole male table bus boy was throwing dishes and silverware into his takeaway tray and making an obnoxious ruckus while diners were still present.  A female server was rolling silverware into napkins in a booth, then a chef comes from the kitchen to join her and talk story.  The floors were a mess.  Napkins under the tables, crumbs and trash all over the floor.  Even the booth we sat in had a huge crumb on the seat which I mistook as ripped furniture.  It's a total different experience at the Ala Moana location.  On to the positives.  The female hostess was smiley and friendly.  Our server Dennis was friendly, professional, and a part time comedian.  He informed me of new changes and additions to the menu starting in December 2015.   I won't go into details on our food because we always order the same thing.  The lettuce wraps, and my ultimate favorite Jambalaya Pasta were awesome as usual.  Oh but wait, we did try a new pasta dish.  FOOD: Spaghetti Bolognese - I never order this dish when eating out, for several reasons.  First off, I can make this at home.  Secondly, most places make it too sweet, yuck!  Thirdly, there's usually more enticing pasta choices available.  Our chance taken was rewarded with satisfaction.  While the meat sauce flavor was a bit mild, it was still appetizing, with just a hint of sweetness that even I approve of.  But where's the garlic bread? TIP: They no longer offer a kamaaina discount.  OVERALL: Great place to do takeout.
The food was ok, but what really blew me away was the service. Our server, Aidan, is the best server in Oahu. He was so cheerful and nice. The restaurant is a good place to get away from the crowds.

I have been here many times, and the food and staff have always been quite good! I always notice how friendly the staff are, and they hustle, especially if there is a wait (and there can be, especially at night). Friendly and efficient staff! The pizza is made to order and very fresh, and the drinks are good (full bar).  Try to get a table outside on the balcony overlooking the tourist area and people watch...but the wait may be longer for a patio table, be warned.  Fresh pizza and huge salads, great staff and a full bar make CPK a spot you have to try!

20 Dec 2015. Negative stars. The staff were pleasant. The California club pizza gave me bed-ridden food poisoning + gastro for 24 hours. It was dog vomit on dough bread. Avoid this joint at all costs.
Meh, food doesn't seem as fresh at this location compared to others on island (imo). Long wait for food and the place smells funny. Needs a good airing out.

Came at 630pm they told us the wait will be 40 to 45 minutes. An hour went by and we asked how long more would it be. They were running behind. They sat us at 745p. We ordered within 5 to 10 minutes and waited till 855p for our food. Everyone around us was getting frustrated. We did get an apology but this is ridiculous. The wait is long because it takes over an hour to get your food. One of the host wasn't even lead people to their table the customers were all in front of him. He sat them at the wrong table. This has to be the worst CPK! We like CPK but we are not coming back to this one.

We arrived at the restaurant at 7:30 pm on a Sunday night expecting we would have to wait a while to get in. It was very crowded and we were told 45 minutes but we decided to stick it out because we were in the mood for pizza and we'd been to other branches of this chain and like their food. At the 45 minute mark I asked how much longer it would be and was told another 15 minutes. It took 25 and we were finally seated. We already knew what we wanted so we gave the waitress our order. Then we overheard another waitress tell another table that pizza orders were backed up for an hour. When ours came back with our drinks we asked her and she said she'd already placed the order and it shouldn't be that long. Well, it took an hour and 15 minutes until our pizza finally showed up. Over an hour for pizza! In a pizza restaurant! It was pretty good but small and not worth the wait. In the meantime we were offered chips and salsa--who wants chips and salsa as an appetizer before pizza? To make it worse there was a table with five drunk Australians next to us who were getting louder and louder and annoying everyone else in the section. Another restaurant would have had a manager tell them to chill or leave but they were allowed to keep being disruptive. We want to make it clear that none of this was our server's fault. She was very apologetic. We gave her a good tip. But this place clearly can't handle a full house. Either hire more cooks, get another oven or don't run such a huge restaurant. All told we spent two and a half hours here for an average pizza and noisy neighbors. A terrible restaurant experience.

Great food with outstanding service--- we are never disappointed when we eat here. This is one of our favorite places when we visit Waikiki each year. Very accommodating to any special request and especially family friendly. Can't say enough good things about the service---courteous, friendly, and fast.

First time at this location. There was about a 20 min wait for two people. Once we were seated, we were greeted by our server Ray. He was absolutely exceptional. We ordered our the BBQ chicken pizza with pineapples and a quesadilla as a starter.  The food took longer than usually and Ray offered us some bread. Maybe about 20-25 minutes after we were seated, our food was served.  The pizza was lacking BBQ sauce and our hand tossed pizza looked like a thin crust pizza. Our previous experience in California had much more toppings and sauce on them. The quesadilla was a small portion that would only be enough for two people, not any more.  Service was great even though the wait was longer as it was prime dinner time. I wish I could say the food was exceptional but was disappointing this time.

Usually California pizza kitchen has amazing service however this specific location had some difficulties this restaurant is definitely One of my family's favourite restaurant however we have waited One hour to get our table 2 hours to get our food not to mention one hour to get the bread that came complementary with the meal on the bright side there is an  attractive waiter like sexy Sadly we found rotten avocado in our salad which was disappointing along with chicken in our other salad  The service was very slow even when the restaurant is empty  However their food is quite incredible when served properly  My family is vegetarian and we highly suggest the Thai chicken salad without the chicken sub avocado, the two In a bowl soup half farmers market half Sedona tortilla and the California veggie  All of these dishes are filled with flavour and very satisfying  If you want good food we suggest California pizza kitchen however if you want bad service we suggest this specific location  CPK

I really enjoyed my pizza today. The atmosphere of being outside in the beautiful weather and watching people made today's lunch entertaining. The pizza I craved today was the sausage, pepperoni and half mushroom. It was so good! The thin crust made great for dipping in the olive oil they give you with bread before your meal. The crust cooked in the brick oven, sauce not too tomatoey and acidic made this pizza a winner! Keith, our waiter was so kind and chatted with us a bit, he made it much more enjoyable!

As soon as we checked in to our hotel, we were starving and debating where to eat. Coming from L.A. all I was in the mood for was traditional Hawaiian food. After endless debate and walking blocks after blocks, my kids and I looked up at CPK and walked up. Great staff-everyone was extremely friendly and our bad moods immediately changed because the waitress was so cool and chatted with us for a bit. We ordered, we ate, we were happy. Recommend this particular location.

Excellent service, friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere and delicious food. I had my birthday dinner here and I definitely enjoyed it. The one of the reasons I really like California Pizza because of their thin crust pizzas.  I ordered Roasted Artichoke + Spinach, however my friends ordered Pear + Gorgonzola pizza was a hit. Definitely my go to for the next time. It was a perfect balance between bosc pears, sweet caramelized onions and hazelnuts, topped with chilled field greens in housemade gorgonzola ranch. If you are sweet taste pizza fan this is must try.

There aren't many American restaurants in Honolulu when needing a break from Asian cuisine. We had an excellent dinner of mushroom and pepperoni thin crust pizzas, spinach dip and asparagus/spinach pasta. Service was fast, but our waitress never came back to check on us or refill our drinks hence the 1 star deduction.
Awesome food and service!   We were seated quickly for a party of four. Pizza and pasta were delicious and filling.  Great for families!

Server was a very young girl and pleasant enough. Our glasses never got refilled, though. She may have been preoccupied with other customers. We sat outside looking down on the street, but noise-level was tolerable. I was totally disappointed with my food. Thai chicken pizza really didn't work for me. The concept of raw unseasoned vegetables on a hot pizza was a terrible idea. I ate it without veggies. Server told me she didn't like it after I was done with it, so why didn't she give me a warning when I ordered it?? Desserts were out of the question at that moment.

I love the Mac and cheese from cpk! It's only on the kids menu but they have always been happy to give me an adult portion of it. I love the spiral noodles and mild cheddar cream sauce. Goes well with a dash of pepper

Always have the best food and service when i come here. free house bread to start, spinach artichoke dip and the california club pizza is the best and my usual order. However last night our server Olivia suggested the spicy chipotle chicken pizza and man oh man it was delicious! Olivia was bright and smiley and made our night one to remember.

Went here for lunch.  We asked to be seated outside  and were promptly forgotten about for 15 mins.  We left and went to the Cheesecake Factory across the road. Was a shame, as the food looked really good. The worst customer service we have experienced in Waikiki
good service...good food...average hawaii prices ($15-20) . the pizza is amazing, and not greasy at all

Just as good as it was last year  BBQ chicken pizza was excellent  We also had the Thai chicken pizza  Very good and for dessert chocolate soufflé with Haagen Daz ice cream  Yummy Our waiter Keith was awesome too

Went to CPK for dinner with my girl it was already busy but we were glad their was seats still open for us:)  We got a really nice waiter his name was Keith. Super nice and friendly guy. He had our time really special and made our day.  We ordered little things today cuz it was a big portion of food! Got spinach and artichoke pizza, garlic sauce pasta, and crudity Mac n cheese. We also got some drinks too cuz Keith was nice enough to give my friend a free sample of the vitamin pomegranate drink. So my friend ordered that cuz she actually liked it and I got myself a peach ice tea which was delicious and sweet! The ice tea was the best! I love the flavor to it! We enough our meal here with our wonderful waiter Keith. Food was delicious and unforgettable we didn't get to eat it all but we took them home! The pizza was good since I love thin crust pizza:D I would highly recommend this place if your in Waikiki looking around and want to grab a bite. I would come here to eat! They don't have much things on the menu since they changed it but they still have the good food up on the menus! Come here and enjoy the food! I know you wouldn't regret it
Went here 2 times on our trip. It was perfect day 1, and second time they messed up the order. Darren, the manager, corrected the issue right away. Very good service. Thank you

FOOD POISONING  I'm currently writing this review from my bathroom floor and I'm not happy to say the least. I've been violently ill since 2 am and it's now 4:40am. I won't go into details but my body is in full detox mode. I had half of a gluten free bbq chicken pizza and a pepperoni. Both tastes sub par and now I'm paying the "ultimate price". Sorry CPK, I won't be back.

We went later in the night and where able to sit on the open veranda . We had great service and the meal was excellent. We came back again later. Great value and great menu with great service. Always happy to eat here.

Normally I love this place but tonight it sucked. We had to wait 30 minutes just to get seated which is understandable since the restaurant is right in Waikiki however I don't expect to wait 15 minutes just to order. You would think that this establishment would have more servers, our waitress was super sweet but very overwhelmed and distracted. It took even longer to get our check. If you plan on having dinner here go before 6 pm or after 9:30. Also plan on wasting some time here waiting. The food is always amazing but I'm not sure if I have time or patience for the wait.

Wow...this location in comparison to the one on Ala Moana are like night and day.  I couldn't get a proper soft drink until mid way through the arrival of our appetizers.  Our waitress (Alice) continuously forgot about our table.  From bringing bread, to cleaning our table of dishes, to forgetting to bring spoons for dessert to share, along with messing up our bill.  I was even more disheartened that nothing was done to try to rectify the horrible service.  Food was good, but my recommendation is to head on over to Ala Moana.

Waited for what seemed forever for anything! I feel so sorry for our sweet waitress who is also takes with taking care of Take Out which seemed busy with construction workers. Never got my mango-iced-tea refill, not even one. The hostess was apathetic and gave me excuses for our waitress not responding without even offering to assist us. Waited so long for our check that the host us to leave, leaving me with the check to pay and it was supposed to be a special lunch. :( With so many food options in Waikiki and being on a second floor you'd think they're invest in customer service and more staff instead of clearly over-tasking and under training existing staff. Hope all my followers avoid this restaurant until I can verify that they've corrected these inexcusable management errors. The only aloha we felt was for our waitress that is great in a horribly managed situation.
Our server Ku'ulei was so courteous, helpful and attentive. She suggested the sesame seared ahi, which was absolutely delicious. And overall made my experience 10/10. Thank you!
What to do with remaining chicken for lettuce wraps? Ask for more lettuce cups but... For 1.50 extra  what cheap asses

Great service food was very tasty would recommend this to anyone staying in Waikiki and after some good food. I would sit outside on the deck as inside smells like a fast food diner. Pizzas and the Sangria flight drinks were on point.

Can't go wrong prices are still comparable to all the locations on island so no complaints here.  Try to go dinner around 5pm to avoid the major crowds.  Located above CocoCove aka. Foodland.  Nice atmosphere, on the dark side but I like it dark. Good service. Clean bathroom.

Pizza was quite good but had to wait after receiving our pizzas for 20 minutes to get drinks. Basically we stopped eating - when asked if pizza could be taken away we said no we just would like some water or beer!

I haven't been to this location in a while and was pleasantly surprised. The service was friendly and efficient. The food quality has improved. The free sourdough bread appetizer was really really good.  We had a flat bread and a pizza that were hot, fresh and tasty.  Our server, Boss, was exactly that.

Came in at night from a long flight and wanted to eat something we knew wouldn't disappoint. By the time we got back to our hotel room, we opened the box and found a very deformed and half burnt pizza. Do not go here, especially at night.
The food was delicious, pizza and dessert. Good tropical drink also. The place was clean with a great atmosphere and excellent service.

Such a terrible experience. Caught our server drinking alcohol at her friend's table which just so happened to be behind us. She would talk to them as she poured my water. Plus the friend's were cussing, loud, and obnoxious. On top of that, it took our server over 30 minutes to get us water. Other patrons were just as upset as we were, one man even yelled at our server for her awful service. We all told another table to leave because of the service and they too were upset that they didn't get their water yet after waiting 30 minutes! It's a shame that such a well established restaurant chain in one of the most centralized tourist destinations in the country has hired some of the worst employees. Drinking on the job, hanging out with friends, and virtually disowning customers definitely deserves 1 star.

Please do not wait to eat at this restaurant as it's never going to be worth the wait if they continue to run this restaurant the way it is currently run. I kid you not we saw a table go uncleared before the table was turned and who failed to clean it after removing drinks off the table top? The manager. The house bread is nothing special and the "small plates" are completely generic. The FOH seemed to be in chaos - relatively young wait staff that seemed to be under trained and easily overwhelmed - completely not their fault and I blame management. The secondary host was annoyingly unproductive. I am usually never this harsh, but I think deservingly so. Our server was the bright spot - Dennis was attentive and went above and beyond. The pizza was at best what I would consider good. I did like the whole wheat option. The atmosphere was sub casual dining and more like fast casual "plus".

Beware of possible food poisoning... Went with a group of 4. Seated promptly just before 7 on a Monday evening.  I ordered Pizza--as Pizza is in the place's name--duh.  It was very good, no complaints! Husband ordered the Chicken Walnut Salad, as did our companions.  He reports only small spreads of chicken, a few walnuts, one or two apple slices and very bitter greens.  The amount of dressing he felt was skimpy.  Of course he did not complain or send it back.   Within hours he was in full blown food poisoning mode--sick as could be--blames the CPK salad.  He is probably correct. We haven't seen our friends yet this morning--so are unsure of their fate.   Consider yourself warned.  I suggest you stick with the meatless pizza, as I had no problem!

Family dinner out and this was the place to relax.  They said 10-15 min wait was more like five.  Olivia was wonderful.  So pleasant attentive and helpful.  The food was great.  Boys ordered pizza.. It was Fresh hot and full of flavor. My Morrocan salad is my newest favorite absolutely delicious.  Olivia served us and those around us w ease.  Looking forward to going back.
I am giving five stars because our waiter Gabe was awesome!! If you go there ask for Gabe!
My first time here and I'm so please with the food. Our server Ari was the absolute sweetest.
Service here is horrible. I know its Waikiki but not everyone is a tourist and wont be back, the disregard and poor service here are ridiculous for the price of the food.

Great food. Service was terrible. We called in the morning and made a reservation for the evening. When we showed up 20 minutes early they said they did not have a reservation for us. Not only that they said they do not take reservations for the balcony which we had specifically asked for and were given. The manager was called over and lightly chuckled as I showed him the time we called that morning and made the reservation. He didn't care and wasn't even willing to make accommodations for us. He said we would just have to come back when it wasn't busy and maybe get a table. How sad the leadership of this establishment was disrespectful. The two stars are for the food.

Came here 3 times in our 4 nights in Waikiki, which surely says enough for the positive experience we had here. Service is always over the top friendly (feels like they are working hard for a good tip) but it is the food that brings you back. Loved the reasonable prices, especially for Waikiki, and impressive portion sizes

This place is decent. Way better than the ones we had in California. I guess it depends on the people who make the good. The island is magical. We had all thin crust pizzas: the Sicilian, wild mushrooms and the Hawaiian(with fresh pineapple), all great. Have faith in CPK again.

Five stars just to get your attention that we had a bad experience!  Let's just begin by saying we never even got to eat there to not even want to dine. We called for a phone order for some pizza, crispy mac n cheese, & buffalo cauliflower! They said it'll be 20 mins pick up!  20 mins later I called and they said they sold out on the crispy mac n cheese and the buffalo cauliflower dropped on the ground and that was the last of it ?! If I wasn't furious and I lost my appetite! They asked if we were still coming in for the pizza. Y'all kidding me. First off! Why wouldn't you say before we waited 20 mins downstairs that you sold out of the mac n cheese ? And second! You drop the cauliflower ? My goodness gracious the worst service ever ! Think twice !!! I've had better service at the ala moana CPK (:

This CPK is tucked upstairs in Waikiki. I think if you drove down Kalakaua, you might miss it. However, it has the same standards as any CPK. It's actually quite spacious with seating indoors as well as covered outdoors. We arrived on a Saturday (Xmas Eve) around 2pm and it was fairly empty. The service was good, refreshments refilled and everything came out in a timely fashion, if not faster. Perhaps with everyone doing last minute shopping and all, we had no problems. Hopefully it's not an anomaly as we love CPK and would come again if hanging out in Waikiki. Unfortunately no pics this time as all the hungry fam devoured their food before I got to it.

We actually came in for dinner on NYE. We were seated immediately. Our server was very nice and attentive. I ordered the coconut cocktail and the garlic fettuccine with shrimp. My daughter ordered the fried cheese appetizer and the lettuce wraps. All our food was very good. Her lettuce wrap appetizer came with only 2 lettuce; we asked for more and more we got. I did not like the Coconut Blossom cocktail. It didn't come with a pineapple like pictured, it was way too strong, and did not have any taste of coconut. I asked them to take it off the check and she did!  I'd definitely come back again.

It was not crowded when we were seated, so the server was attentive, took our order and all that and the food was served in a timely manner. All the food tasted good, the shrimp scampi pasta, mushroom pasta, mushroom pizza, veggie pizza, & pepperoni/sausage/mushroom pizza. The mushroom pizza comes with a side of truffle oil, which enhances the flavor profile. The mushroom pasta has a different kind of pasta -- it is a rolled pasta and tastes more grainy that the usual pasta. All the pizza had a regular crust - crispy yet soft & chewy. The butter cake dessert was very good, it was warm and had a hard sugar glaze on it - and the ice cream does make it better. The only issue was that the server was nice, but had a hard time asking if we wanted refills or anything like that, we had to ask him for them instead of the opposite.
This is always a good place to get a quick delicious pasta or pizza,  I have tried several things and have enjoyed them all.  It's a cheap and delicious option in Waikiki.
If I could give it less stars I would. Waited almost 2 hours for our food. Ended up walking out!! Never going there again!! So many other excellent pizza place on the island.

Back on Oahu and came back to CPK. Great service. Good food. We split the spinach and mushroom flatbread. Hot and tasty. I had the Thai chicken salad. Fresh. Crispy. Right amount of spice and dressing. My husband had a pasta dish. Must have been good. Nothing was left. Overall, a every nice dining experience. Place was packed but our timing was great. No wait for a table.

Great service at this super busy family friendly restaurant. We were seated surprisingly quickly after being handed a buzzer to wait 15 minutes. Arthur our waiter was fantastic.  We had the Bianco Flatbread with whipped truffle cream, Gorgonzola cheese, mozzarella and sage and the "The Works" pizza. Both were yummy. The stars of the night however were the Cocktails.  Mai Thai, pina colada and the Sangria flight.  A Sangria flight is a great deal to try all three.  Beehive Sangria was my favourite.
Super slow service. Came at a not so busy hour and waited for our pizza forever. Food was good though.

An okay experience. On par with what you would expect in a chain restaurant in a tourist destination. Getting a drink at the bar was frustrating and took way too long, especially considering it was not that crowded. I ordered a Bombay sapphire and sprite (they don't have tonic water) and the bartender shook the drink like 6 times... it's soda? Ugh. The host was great and got me a table on the balcony overlooking the Waikiki strip which is a great view. Our server was also excellent and the pizza was exactly as it should be.

Looking for a place to grab dinner on waikiki beach and everything had a huge wait. CPK said 15 minutes and we were seated. The strawberry mango cooler is the best drink. This time I shared the lettuce wraps. For a pizza place I thought they were very good. Not anything special about California pizza kitchen but seems like it has a lot shorter weight than more of the restaurants around.

I really like CPK but haven't had such good experiences with this location. The kung pao spaghetti that I had for dinner last night was so oily. I felt kind of sick after eating it. Plus there were way too many nuts in it. My friend's pear and gorgonzola pizza was overcooked too so she had to get a new one. We only came here because the wait for Cheesecake Factory was more than an hour. The egg rolls were good and the spinach artichoke dip... but not very impressed with the main entrees, especially considering the price. Service was a little bit slow too. I don't really think I want to go back here.

The little one was craving pizza, so we went to CPK for lunch. CPK is a bit out of the way because it's on the second floor and not very visible from the street, and it was completely deserted when we arrived.  The menu is pretty pricey. For lunch, most of the options were at least $15, and nothing was particularly good or interesting. The kids' menu was particularly disappointing because it was about $7 for just the pizza alone, without any sort of sides, dessert or beverage.  Service was really friendly and fast, but we were just not into the food.

This is my fiancee's and I first time ever at @ CPK the food was good can't complain. Service was all right, love the ambience of the restaurant though. I would recommend anyone to go there and try there great fresh tasty teas
White corn guacamole and chips for appetizer today. Too bad it's very small portion. and comfortable mood

I've eaten at CPK several times sense living in Kailua and it's always been worth it. Everything on their menu is tasty, and there is plenty of variety to choose from. Service is always fast, even for a takeout pizza order. Price for eating out in Hawaii is also reasonable. I also really like their outdoor seating area, and that they are dog friendly and will let you have your pup with you if you are eating outside. Friendly atmosphere, and I look forward to having lunches and dinner here in the future.
I was at this restaurant about 40 days ago. I love the food. Pizza was fantastic and we had a cauliflower appetizer which was fantastic as well. The staff great. I recommend it to any pizza lover.

I recently held my son's 6th birthday party here with 13 kids and 15 adults. Overall it was great. Our contact, Katrina, was very responsive to email beforehand and very attentive and flexible on the day-of.  The kids made pizza, got a tour of the restaurant, then ate the pizzas and had cake (which we brought). The whole party lasted about 2 hours, even though it was scheduled for 1.5 hrs (9:30-11am). In retrospect, a cake was not necessary because CPK provides sundaes as part of the kid's meal. The cost is $10/kid. I appreciated that Katrina was attentive to cleanliness, asking the kids to wash hands before the pizza making. For the adults, we ordered 3 spinach artichoke dips, 2 salads, and 5 pizzas. That was just about right... not too heavy since it wasn't quite lunch time yet. I took off one star for a couple reasons. First, parking in Waikiki was a big concern of mine. I researched beforehand and in the end, here are the best options I found: 1) Waikiki parking garage on Seaside Ave, first driveway on the right, $7 flat rate 2) Elite parking garage on Seaside Ave, second driveway on the right, next to Ross, first 2 hrs free with validation (any Ross purchase) and $3/half hour after that.  Both garages are just around the corner from CPK (5 min walk). Second reason for four stars is that I felt 1.5 hours was a little tight. Thankfully, Katrina did not rush us at all, but I felt bad for staying beyond the scheduled end time. If your guests are not punctual...as most local people aren't (myself included!), it's very hard to stick to the 1.5 hr time frame. Our entire party didn't arrive until nearly 10am, and we were out around 11:30. Tips: we saved a little by buying gift cards at Sams Club. Also, if you prefer Ala Moana or Kahala locations, book a couple months in advance. I didn't and that's how we ended up in Waikiki...but it all worked out and I'm thankful that they were able to accommodate us with less than a month's notice. Our guests seemed to enjoy themselves and those who had never done this before thought it was a great experience, so we'd highly recommend it!! Again, props to Katrina and her staff--they were wonderful! :)
Did not like my pizza. I got spinach n archoke pizza. It was very dry. I did say something to my server Haley. She just said it doesn't have sauce. Didn't try to fix my complaint.

They gave us bad service just because they thought we were Japanese tourists!!! While the food was good, the service definitely was not. I recently went here with a couple of friends (from Japan) who have been studying abroad here for a year (they have very advanced English abilities). When we entered the restaurant, we were immediately asked if we wanted a menu in another language. (I am JAPANESE-AMERICAN and they automatically assumed I was foreign) We politely refused but the waitress but she asked again more insistently saying that the "menu was complicated and might be hard for [us] to understand." We refused again. She finally took us to our seats. We noticed that the table was dirty and when we asked for it to be cleaned the waitress sighed and mumbled "it's just pepper, honey, calm down." We ordered our food and waited for about 30 minutes for our food to come. During this time, people had been sitting next to us but they were given the option to sit elsewhere and, thus, we were sitting in a secluded area with little service. Only later did we notice that we did not get any bread. (By this time we had already gotten our food and decided we didn't need it) We were still eating when the waitress came around and asked if we were finished. We told them we were still working on it. She came back a few minutes later and asked if we were finished with our meals again, as if she did not notice that we were still eating off our plates. Again, we told her we were still eating. The waitress returned a few minutes with the check and tried to take away our dishes. This was already the third time that she tried to take away our dishes when we were still eating! When I opened up the check, I noticed the words "MAHALO" written in red marker, the tip calculations were circled with huge smiley faces around it. I knew that they thought we were tourists, but I couldn't help but feel offended. We had come in for an early dinner (so there was not that many people there)....but why were they giving us so much attitude? Why were they trying to make us leave asap?! The only reason why I could think of was because they thought we were Japanese tourists...the people around us were not treated in this way!  Annoyed, I left less of a tip than what they wanted but, honestly, I should not have given them any tip at all. I wrote them a note on the back of the check and hope that NO ONE has to have an experience like this because of their assumed nationality again.

This location is very busy but luckily for a Friday night the wait was only 20 mins which wasn't bad, as expected actually. We had the choice of sitting inside or outside, we opted in for whatever was available first so we sat outside.  Our server was very attentive at first, taking our drink order then getting that and then taking our food order. As soon as we got our food, that was the last we saw our server...with that being said that part ruined my experience. Check on your damn party at least ONCE after you give them your meal not until you see them piling up the dishes for you and waiting for them to call you over for the bill.  Food wise, the selection is great - the menu is just right even though it makes indecisive people like myself question their decision over and over again. I opted for a salad and soup. The soup was excellent, I beloved it was the harvest selection, flavor was strong and a bowl size is a great portion paired with a small sized salad. The other people in my party enjoyed their pizzas and pasta dish, sorry I was too busy eating to try to attempt to try a bite of theirs.  Nonetheless the food was great, the service needed help but hey you get what you pay for and you get paid for your service you provide.

CPK never lets me down. I've eaten at every location on the island. The the food is always delicious and the staff is always friendly and professional! I particularly love the Waikiki location, especially the atmosphere while sitting on the deck outside. My new favorite thing to get is the hand rolled mushroom pasta. It's so delicious, highly recommend! Also, don't forget the butter cake for dessert. Try it with the vanilla ice cream, just trust me ;)

Service here from the staff was less than stellar.  The place was not crowded and when I asked to sit elsewhere I was told by the waiter Keith there were other people waiting who came after me. Manager Connie was very nice and apologetic yet did not do anything to resolve the issue. On a positive note the food was good

Found another place that never does happy hour. Crazy! You know what else I thought was Crazy? They have the calorie count of the drinks on the menu, but not the prices. When I asked the server why, she said it was because different locations have different pricing. I thought this was weird since CPK is a chain restaurant. Anyway my drink was very tasty albeit pretty expensive for its tiny size but I was there to celebrate my Sorority sister, so I just went with it. There were 20 of us and 1 server. She took the orders just fine but when the food was brought, she wasn't there to let the other guys know where what went so it was kind of all over the place for a bit. The restaurant serves complimentary bread with seasoned olive oil while you wait on food. The bread was really fresh - crisp crust and nice squishy middle. Here is where my disappointment came from: I ordered the avocado egg rolls for appetizer. They looked really pretty sitting on the plate when they got there with their dual dippikng sauces. I first noticed how greasy they were when I picked up the first piece and oil dripped down my fingers. I just wiped my hand and proceeded to bite my first piece. When I tell you that oil squirted everywhere, I promise you I'm not exaggerating. My shirt, back into the plate, my neighbor's place setting... It was sincerely gross. I couldn't eat more than one piece!

I am a pizza freak, but this place made me sick! I ordered the classic bbq chicken pizza with bacon, and it wasn't what I expected. I was hoping for a good pizza, but I was just given garbage. The bbq sauce tasted weird, the chicken was trash, and the sauce was just horrible. I think the best thing on that pizza was the plate. The one thing I liked, were the drinks. The ice tea is very good with enough flavor. The other drink I ordered was a mango strawberry drink (I can't remember), but it was sweet enough so that it didn't hurt. Overall, crappy food, but good drinks. One more thing, i git physically sick after eating the monser of of a pizza. It was honestly as big as the plate.

I have never been to California kitchen before, but since it was near I decided to try it. The hostess was nice and got us a good seat. It was the booth away from the door.   Our waiter greeted us...But... He obviously practices poor hygiene. He smelled awful. Almost making me lose my appetite. It was if he didn't shower for days. He was still nice though. Kinda slow moving. I ordered the Thai salad and the works pizza and the pasta kids meal with meat sauce. I was actually really impressed with the salad it had a lot of ingredients and veggies... It was crunchy and the dressing was delicious. The pizza... Seemed weak to me. The sauce wasnt flavorful, or there just want enough sauce. My son's pasta was good, and it it's kid approved because he almost ate the whole plate. I also had the mango tea. It was good. The restaurant was clean. It had a nice environment.

Absolutely horrible service!!! They did not just mess up my order for my salad. But gave me a Caesar salad and just threw the dressing for BBQ salad on it. Completely ridiculous. Lady was so rude and super sassy. Wish I could give her a negative tip but she got a $1. Ridiculous

Good solid food. Good prices.  Tonight I had the BBQ chicken salad, half portion.  It was okay.  The salad lacked flavor.  I should have ordered the pizza but was  trying to be healthy.  My cocktail, watermelon gin martini was fabulous.  I am glad I live nearby.

I'm torn what to rate it. I'd give it a five for convenience and availability. However it's still a chain Oman island abundant with flavors and culture. Had to eat here because we were too exhausted to wait and too large a party to be seated anywhere else. The food is what you would expect from a pizza chain. Edible, but nothing more. Service was friendly as is all Hawaii, but our waitress was new so life was a little slow. Not bad at all, just slow. The management here is great. The place is clean. Manager noticed they ran out of ahi for my moms dish, so she came got a new order and rushed the preparation, so my moms meal was ready with everyone else's even though it was only five minutes out. Great response time.

Had a great lunch today at one of my favorite CPK's. We asked for the BLT pizza, even tho it's not on the menu. Our very nice server (and handsome too) Christian, assured us that we could have that. He was a wonderful young man and very attentive We had some nice conversation with him and also the manager, Connie. Later we found out he is from Huntington Beach as am I. Thanks Christian and Connie for making our lunch fun and very delicious

We were told a 20 minute wait... 50 minutes later we were  seated. Spinach artichoke dip for appetizer was good, but like another Yelper said, the chips were stale! An hour after we ordered our food came. The Hawaiian pizza and 5 cheese plus pepperoni. Both of us really enjoyed the pizza. The service is what took away from our visit. Over 2 hours from when we arrived until we received our food. And for the love of god change the music that's played!
Delicious pizza & pasta! Highly recommend the Thai Shrimp spaghetti & Thai chicken pizza. Outdoor seating is a nice view of the Waikiki strip.
Great Pizza, service & price and the topper they had chilli flakes. Will be going back for sure

Customer service at this location is very poor.  Went in for take out, order messed up.  When tried to resolve the issue on the phone was on hold for 10 minutes, I decided to hang up. Went back to restaurant to resolve the issue, staff made as if it was my fault. Not sure why I was on hold for so long, the place was empty. It was in between lunch and diner crowds. A lot of better options to eat especially in the middle of Waikiki.
Litterally felt like I was eating a piece of paper. No flavor at all. The bread is not chewable. Too expensive for that low quality.

Food always amazing. Yes while in Hawaii I came to CPK. My absolute favorite chain restaurant. A bit slow but we got there. Our server Gabe was cool. His  bus boy cool. Front host Jebe was very rude. Asked for change due to the fact that our sever was slammed and threw her hands up and in a very rude manner told us " oh no! I don't do that!" So when asked okay, well where can I get change at, she said "oh, well your server....." You are the first interaction that us customers have with the restaurant. You represent the the chain. You are the restaurant. My word of advice is have customer service training. Over all great experience. Thanks Gabe!

Food is good. Location is nice. The waitress was terrible. Made a mess of every part of our order and meal. The group of guys sitting outside the restaurant dealing drugs didn't help the atmosphere at all.  We should have eaten at Tikis.

We had booked a table. Upon arrival to our table - the table next to us (group of asians) decided they wanted to be moved to our table and moved themselves whilst we and the hostess watched. I advised the hostess that was wrong and wanted our table. Instead of telliing the asians we had booked the table she advised them that " i wanted the table ". They refused to move off our table and we were seated in a back corner. Apart from a bad hostess the food was crap and u could get better at an ABC store really.  The inside of the place smelt like carpet that had gone mouldy. Avoid avoid avoid. Worst dining experience in waikiki.
The food is always good!.. the service was great. From the hostess to my server! I was alone and felt very comfortable.

Just ok, nothing amazing. We had the BBQ pizza which was not bad. Service was good. The best part of this was definitely the view/atmosphere. I recommend sitting upstairs outside where you can people watch on the busy tourist area below. The location is excellent for this.

Went here for lunch and there wasn't a wait at all. We were seated almost immediately. Food was good and service was ok.  I didn't get that personalized CPK experience.  Menu specials weren't discussed, no connection with customers and lastly drinks weren't refilled without asking.   -2 stars

Long time lurker, first time poster.  My partner and I order a pasta and two pizzas tonight. The California club pizza they gave to us without the toppings, as they intended to keep the cold toppings separate to the hot pizza, and just forgot to give them to us. I called the restaurant when we got back to the hotel and realised and the manager was really nice and offered us a new pizza which we came back to pick up. When we got to the restaurant we got our order but the toppings were ridiculous: 3 slices of tomato and 3 slices of avocado for a whole pizza!! The website menu shows one slice of tomato and slice of avo for each slice of pizza so there should have been 6. When I questioned the guy about this he remarked to another worker, 'what's up with these guys' right in front of us. The second guy (who was the guy who packed our initial order) asked what we wanted and I told him he forgot half our pizza and he just replied with 'yeah the cold toppings are just here on the bench.' He didn't apologise or even acknowledge the fact that he was the one who messed up. In the end we did get more of the avo and tomato but not without an argument. Both men were so blatantly rude and disrespectful. We will not be coming back after this experience.

I hate writing a review with such little stars because both our food and server were excellent.  However, the minus stars are for 2 things: 1. After we've  already ordered and finished our appetizer a manager approaches my boyfriend and tells him that the ahi isn't fresh and he wouldn't feel right serving it to him so my bf changes his order to the ribeye. Not even 2 minutes after he leaves our table my food (a salad and a pizza) arrives. When the waitress brings my food she tells us that no one even told her they were out of ahi. When she saw my food she asked where the ahi was and that's when she found out. Really? Shouldn't the kitchen inform the waitress right away? WTH? So I'm sitting there feeling bad because I have my food and my bf is watching me eat. Even the sorry from the manager was non-chalant. All of this and no discount or even a comp dessert.  2. The table we were at was right in the middle area of the restaurant near the server's station. All night we listened to the servers and managers talk about bills and talking about their customers and tips. They even knew we could hear because they would look at me and smile or turn away quickly. It is so unprofessional to be talking about customers infront of other customers.
Good gluten free pizza but this place smells Bad. Musty, smelly like a terrible sweaty locker room -- the whole Restaurant. Had to get our food to go!!!!! Turnoff!

Came here on Veterans Day and they had a nice menu set aside for vets to receive a free meal. Select full size salads, pizzas, and pasta were on the menu. We shared the entree size Thai crunch salad, which was consistent with the way it made in locations in NJ. Decent service. Restaurant was a little empty for a Saturday late afternoon, but we had a nice server and enjoyed our meal. Also has a chamomile tea which came in a cute individual teapot.
Came for an early dinner with my fiancé and had a great experience! Chipotle pizza was delicious! Had a tasty sangria as well... our server Cabe was so nice and hospitable.. definitely recommended !

It's been a while since I have yelped, but this experience really deserves it. My wife and I were in Waikiki and just wanted a nice take out meal that we knew would be good which we could take back to the hotel - so CPK. We picked it up and took it back to the room and noticed a small mistake. Not a big deal, and was a special order situation so totally understand. The food was amazing and hit the spot. The SERVICE when we called back to explain the situation was over the top in the best way possible. Dave the manager made everything more than okay, making a disappointment turn into a surprisingly wonderful experience. Through this experience I've obtained a high degree of respect for this organization and can attest to what a great management team and support staff CPK has at this restaurant. We'll be back.

There's always something for everyone on the menu. I love how they add season items and seem to keep the favorites but add a little something special every few months.  My new favorite is the Asian Chopped Salad and of course I have to start with the bread and an ice tea. CPK never disappoints (unless it's the Kailua location)  Happy Eating!
Excellent pizza and beautiful service..Spicy Cauliflower and Sicilian pizza are the best. Service is the best so far in Hawaii...Be your own judge

Ahi was perfect once again I love coming to this place our server was Rob and he did a killer job! Very friendly I'm already looking forward to coming again I tell all my friends who come to Honolulu for a vacation to come here and eat and have the seared Ahi

Great pizza with authentic base, delicious cocktails both reasonably priced. I had shrimp pizza, husband had the works, both delicious. Only marked down a star due to slow service, however Honolulu marathon was on at the time so seemed very busy. We would go back.

As much as I love CPK, this location has gone downhill. It's the main one I go to and this past year has been really bad. I order takeout and pick up when I'm supposed to but end up waiting at least another 15 minutes. Last time I waited an additional 40 minutes. At least the manager was good at recognizing that my food was way late. Also, the sit down service isn't great anymore. Waiting 15-20 has been the experience for the last year when eating in just waiting for a waiter to arrive at our table. Then food takes forever and for some reason they can't get their pizza rewards working online.

Good points: seated a table of 5 in less than 15 minutes.  Bread with herbed oil was delicious.  Bad points:  all food did not come out at once; server took forever, never offered adults drink refills , very noisy- wedge salad on appetizer was just iceberg lettuce and very little anything else, flatbread was cold when served.  Not the best representation of this chain restaurant

This 5 stars "only" goes to the female BOH manager who tried and handled her best to manage floor today. I made clear complain to CPK site about how super super horrible for scheduling this location but this manager made such a great patient and tried her best to cover the entire floor.. hope you all realized about her work and promote her in near future. Remember all people want to take day off during holiday season but she took such a great response to take care of this big location. Her name is Joy by the way..

not even angry, just disappointed honestly. i love CPK and usually my boyfriend and i go to the alamoana one because they are always on their a-game, the service is always great and the food is fast. anyway, this place is just not good. obviously the food will always be cpk food, you cant really mess that up. but the wait took more than the estimated. the time was supposed to be 20 minutes and the place had 5 tables seated and a lot more open. i dont even know why the wait was 20 minutes in the first place. my boyfriend and i were sitting on the stairs with the little buzzing mechanism and it didnt go off. we went to go to the counter and the hostess that she was trying to call us ((but if we had the mechanism then why would she call us? wouldnt she just let it buzz to notify that we could sit?)) to top that off there were people who came after us that got sat and served before we did. like what??? then we sat down, finally and we waited about 10 minutes for water, like cool good job, guys! feeling really welcomed. then it takes forever for the server to come. and its not the servers fault at all, its the owner of this specific CPK because it is severely understaffed. i feel bad that 3 people are running around trying to sit and feed everyone. and the servers are nice too, theyre legit just trying as hard as they can. but yeah im just not gonna coke to this cpk ever again ‍ highly recommend the alamoana one or the kahala one though

Loved the food and our server Erick was awesome.  The place was super busy but he did a great job being engaging and keeping us updated on our order.  So glad we stop here to eat on our last night in Waikiki.  Carne Asada pizza was the best.
